member.name: T:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability
member.summary: Represents an ability (skill/spell) object in the game, attached to units and responsible for managing ability lifecycle, state, and cooldowns.
member.remarks: Abilities are the core system for unit capabilities in the game, including spells, skills, attacks, and special powers. Each ability manages its own state, cooldowns, resource costs, and execution logic. Abilities can be granted by the unit's base configuration or by items, and they support various modes including active, toggle, and passive behaviors. The ability system integrates with other game systems like targeting, effects, and animations to provide comprehensive gameplay mechanics. Abilities can persist through unit transformations based on their configuration.

member.name: P:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.LevelMax
member.summary: Gets the maximum level this ability can reach.
member.value: The maximum level allowed for this ability, or null if there is no level limit.
member.remarks: The maximum level determines how many times an ability can be upgraded or improved. Some abilities may not have level restrictions and can be upgraded indefinitely.

member.name: P:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.IsGrantedByItem
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this ability is granted by an item.
member.value: True if the ability comes from an equipped or possessed item; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Item-granted abilities typically have special behaviors such as persisting through unit transformations and being removed when the item is unequipped or destroyed.

member.name: P:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.IsPersistDuringMorph
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this ability persists when the unit undergoes morphing or transformation.
member.value: True if the ability should remain active during morph effects; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Abilities can be configured to persist through unit transformations either through explicit configuration or by being granted by items. This is important for maintaining unit capabilities during temporary transformation effects.

member.name: P:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.ShouldPersistDuringMorph
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this ability should persist during morphing operations.
member.value: True if the ability should remain available during transformations; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property controls whether the ability remains accessible when the unit is transformed. It can be set either from the ability's configuration data or modified dynamically.

member.name: P:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.Paused
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the ability is currently paused.
member.value: True if the ability is paused and not actively processing; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Paused abilities do not execute their periodic effects or update their states. This is used for temporarily suspending ability functionality without removing the ability.

member.name: M:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.Replace(GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.AbilitySystem.Data.GameDataAbility})
member.summary: Replaces the current ability's data configuration with a new data link.
member.param: The new ability data link to apply to this ability.
member.returns: True if the replacement was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method allows dynamic modification of ability behavior by changing its underlying data configuration. The replacement will fail if the provided link contains invalid data. This is useful for ability evolution, morphing effects, or item-based ability modifications.

member.name: M:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this ability.
member.returns: A formatted string containing the ability's type, friendly name, and sync ID.

member.name: P:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.SyncIdType
member.summary: Gets the synchronization ID type for this ability.
member.value: The sync ID type indicating this is an ability object.

member.name: M:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.#ctor(GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit,GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.AbilitySystem.Data.GameDataAbility},GameCore.ItemSystem.Item,GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability@)
member.summary: Initializes a new ability instance attached to the specified unit.
member.param: The unit that will own this ability.
The game data link defining the ability's configuration.
The item that grants this ability, or null if it's a native ability.
Returns the final ability instance after manager processing.
member.exception: Thrown when the provided link has invalid data.
member.remarks: This constructor sets up the ability with all necessary components including modification management, state tracking, cooldown integration, and manager registration. The ability may be processed or modified by the manager before being returned as the final instance.

member.name: M:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.GameCore#BaseInterface#IAttachedObject{GameCore#AbilitySystem#Ability,GameCore#AbilitySystem#Data#GameDataAbility}#OnAttached
member.summary: Handles the ability attachment process and initializes active functionality.
member.remarks: This method is called when the ability is successfully attached to its host unit. It initializes response handlers, refreshes states and modifications on the server, and sets up passive periodic effects if configured.

member.name: M:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Releases managed resources used by this ability.
member.remarks: This method cleans up all ability resources including timers, event handlers, cooldowns, and manager registrations. It ensures proper cleanup when the ability is removed from its host.

member.name: P:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Ability.GameCore#DisplayInfo#IDisplayInfo#Level
member.summary: Gets the current level value for display purposes, or if the level is not set.

member.name: P:GameCore.AbilitySystem.Data.Struct.AbilityFlags.DisableWhenDead

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.AnimTrailSetting
member.summary: 定义动画轨迹的配置设置，控制轨迹效果的外观和行为
member.remarks: AnimTrailSetting 类用于配置各种轨迹类型的视觉效果，如刀光、剑气粒子等。 它定义了轨迹的起始和结束附着点、宽度以及渲染模式，为创建丰富的视觉效果提供了灵活的配置选项。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.AnimTrailSetting.SocketA
member.summary: 获取或设置轨迹的第一个附着点名称
member.remarks: 附着点 A 通常作为轨迹的起始点或其中一个端点。 附着点名称对应于 3D 模型中定义的骨骼或挂载点。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.AnimTrailSetting.SocketB
member.summary: 获取或设置轨迹的第二个附着点名称
member.remarks: 附着点 B 通常作为轨迹的结束点或另一个端点。 与附着点 A 配合，定义了轨迹的空间范围和方向。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.AnimTrailSetting.Width
member.summary: 获取或设置轨迹的宽度
member.remarks: 定义轨迹效果的视觉宽度，影响轨迹在屏幕上的粗细程度。 较大的值会创建更粗的轨迹效果，较小的值则创建更细的轨迹。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.AnimTrailSetting.Mode
member.summary: 获取或设置轨迹的渲染模式
member.remarks: 控制轨迹在附着点之间的绘制方式和方向。 默认模式为从附着点 A 到附着点 B 的直线轨迹。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.MiniMapIcon
member.summary: 定义小地图图标的配置，包含不同状态和朝向下的图标资源
member.remarks: MiniMapIcon 类用于配置 Actor 在小地图上的显示方式。它支持多种图标状态， 包括友方、敌方、旋转等不同情况下的图标显示，以及层级控制。 这样可以为玩家提供清晰的小地图视觉信息。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.MiniMapIcon.Icon
member.summary: 获取或设置默认的小地图图标
member.remarks: 这是最基本的图标，在没有特殊状态时显示。 通常用于中性或友方单位的默认表示。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.MiniMapIcon.IconRotated
member.summary: 获取或设置带有旋转方向的小地图图标
member.remarks: 当需要显示单位朝向时使用的图标，通常包含箭头或方向指示器。 可以根据单位的实际朝向进行旋转显示。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.MiniMapIcon.IconEnemy
member.summary: 获取或设置敌方单位的小地图图标
member.remarks: 专门用于显示敌方单位的图标，通常使用不同的颜色或样式来区分敌友。 帮助玩家快速识别小地图上的威胁。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.MiniMapIcon.IconEnemyRotated
member.summary: 获取或设置敌方单位带有旋转方向的小地图图标
member.remarks: 敌方单位的朝向图标，结合了敌方标识和方向指示。 让玩家既能识别敌方单位，又能了解其朝向。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.MiniMapIcon.IconSelfRotated
member.summary: 获取或设置玩家自身单位带有旋转方向的小地图图标
member.remarks: 专门用于显示玩家控制的单位的朝向图标，通常具有特殊的视觉样式。 帮助玩家快速定位和识别自己的单位。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Struct.MiniMapIcon.ZIndex
member.summary: 获取或设置图标的 Z 轴顺序，决定其相对于其他元素的堆叠顺序
member.remarks: 数值越高的图标会渲染在上层，覆盖数值较低的图标。 用于控制不同类型图标在小地图上的显示优先级。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.ActorSegmentedHeight
member.summary: 定义 Actor 分段高度的配置选项，控制 Actor 链条中各部分的垂直位置分布
member.remarks: 此枚举用于配置由多个分段组成的 Actor（如激光束、闪电链等）的高度分布模式。 不同的高度模式会影响分段 Actor 的视觉表现和空间定位。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.ActorSegmentedHeight.LaunchSite
member.summary: 启动点高度 - 所有分段使用启动点的高度
member.remarks: 所有分段都保持在启动点的原始高度，不进行高度调整。 适用于需要保持水平线性分布的效果。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.ActorSegmentedHeight.LaunchSiteGround
member.summary: 启动点地面高度 - 使用启动点的地面高度
member.remarks: 所有分段都调整到启动点所在位置的地面高度。 适用于需要沿地面分布的效果，如地面冲击波等。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.ActorSegmentedHeight.AllGrounded
member.summary: 全部贴地 - 每个分段都调整到其所在位置的地面高度
member.remarks: 每个分段独立调整到其所在位置的地面高度，形成跟随地形的效果。 适用于需要贴合地形变化的效果，如沿地面传播的魔法等。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.AnimTrailMode
member.summary: 定义动画轨迹的渲染模式，控制轨迹效果在不同附着点之间的绘制方式
member.remarks: 动画轨迹模式用于配置如刀光、剑气粒子等拥有多个端点的粒子效果的渲染方向和起终点。 不同的模式决定了轨迹从哪个点开始，到哪个点结束，以及是否有中心点参与。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.AnimTrailMode.FromCenterToSocketAB
member.summary: 从中心点到附着点 A 和 B - 创建从中心分叉到两个端点的轨迹
member.remarks: 轨迹从一个中心位置开始，同时延伸到附着点 A 和附着点 B。 适用于需要从一个源点向多个目标发射的效果，如分裂闪电或多目标法术。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.AnimTrailMode.FromSocketAToSocketB
member.summary: 从附着点 A 到附着点 B - 创建直接连接两个附着点的轨迹
member.remarks: 轨迹从附着点 A 开始，直接延伸到附着点 B。 适用于点对点的连接效果，如激光束、链条或直线型魔法攻击。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.AnimTrailMode.FromSocketBToSocketA
member.summary: 从附着点 B 到附着点 A - 创建从 B 到 A 方向的轨迹
member.remarks: 轨迹从附着点 B 开始，直接延伸到附着点 A。 与 FromSocketAToSocketB 相反的方向，用于需要反向连接的效果。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.MaterialPriority
member.summary: 定义材质的渲染优先级，控制材质在渲染管线中的处理顺序
member.remarks: 材质优先级用于解决渲染顺序冲突，确保重要的视觉效果能够正确显示。 较高优先级的材质会在较低优先级之后渲染，从而覆盖在其上方。 这对于 UI 元素、特效和透明物体的正确显示非常重要。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.MaterialPriority.Priority1
member.summary: 优先级 1 - 最低优先级，最先渲染
member.remarks: 适用于背景元素、地形和其他应该在底层显示的材质。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.MaterialPriority.Priority2
member.summary: 优先级 2 - 较低优先级
member.remarks: 适用于一般的 3D 模型和环境对象。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.MaterialPriority.Priority3
member.summary: 优先级 3 - 中等优先级
member.remarks: 适用于角色模型、重要的游戏对象和中层视觉效果。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.MaterialPriority.Priority4
member.summary: 优先级 4 - 较高优先级
member.remarks: 适用于粒子效果、光晕和需要显示在大多数对象之上的元素。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.MaterialPriority.Priority5
member.summary: 优先级 5 - 最高优先级，最后渲染
member.remarks: 适用于 UI 元素、HUD、文字和必须显示在最顶层的视觉效果。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.ParentRemovalProcedure
member.summary: 定义当父级 Actor 被移除时，子 Actor 的处理程序
member.remarks: 此枚举控制 Actor 层级关系中，当父级对象被销毁或移除时， 其子级对象应该如何响应。不同的处理方式适用于不同类型的 Actor 关系和使用场景。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.ParentRemovalProcedure.Default
member.summary: 默认处理 - 如果是单位 Actor 则分离，否则移除
member.remarks: 如果 Actor 是单位类型，当父级被移除时会从父级分离但继续存在； 如果是其他类型的 Actor，则会被一同移除。 这提供了基于 Actor 类型的智能默认行为。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.ParentRemovalProcedure.Remove
member.summary: 移除处理 - Actor 会在父级移除时自动移除自身
member.remarks: 当父级被移除时，子 Actor 也会被自动销毁。 适用于生命周期完全依赖于父级的 Actor，如特效、附属装饰等。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.ParentRemovalProcedure.Detach
member.summary: 分离处理 - Actor 会从父级分离但不会被自动移除
member.remarks: 当父级被移除时，子 Actor 会从层级关系中分离出来， 但会继续独立存在，不会被自动销毁。 适用于具有独立生命周期的 Actor。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.SoundPlayMode
member.summary: 定义音频播放的模式，控制多个音频文件的播放顺序和选择方式
member.remarks: 当一个 Actor 包含多个音频文件时，播放模式决定了系统如何选择和播放这些音频。 不同的播放模式可以创建不同的音频体验，如按顺序播放或随机播放。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.SoundPlayMode.Sequential
member.summary: 顺序播放 - 按照预定义的顺序依次播放音频文件
member.remarks: 音频文件将按照它们在列表中的顺序依次播放。 适用于需要保持特定播放顺序的场景，如故事叙述、音乐序列等。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.SoundPlayMode.Random
member.summary: 随机播放 - 随机选择音频文件进行播放
member.remarks: 系统将随机选择一个音频文件进行播放，增加音频的多样性。 适用于环境音效、战斗音效等需要变化的场景。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.TextHorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Defines the horizontal alignment options for text rendering.

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.TextHorizontalAlignment.Left
member.summary: Aligns text to the left edge of the container.

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.TextHorizontalAlignment.Center
member.summary: Centers text horizontally within the container.

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.TextHorizontalAlignment.Right
member.summary: Aligns text to the right edge of the container.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.TextVerticalAlignment
member.summary: 定义文本渲染的垂直对齐选项
member.remarks: 垂直对齐选项控制文本在容器或边界框内的垂直位置。 这些选项通常与水平对齐配合使用，以精确控制文本的显示位置。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.TextVerticalAlignment.Top
member.summary: 顶部对齐 - 文本与容器的顶部边缘对齐
member.remarks: 文本的第一行贴近容器的顶部边界显示。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.TextVerticalAlignment.Center
member.summary: 居中对齐 - 文本在容器内垂直居中
member.remarks: 文本块在容器的垂直方向上居中显示，上下留有相等的空间。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.Enum.TextVerticalAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: 底部对齐 - 文本与容器的底部边缘对齐
member.remarks: 文本的最后一行贴近容器的底部边界显示。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor
member.summary: Represents the base data class for actor configurations, defining common properties and behaviors for all actor types. GameData normally generated from the Data Editor, but can also be created programmatically.
member.remarks: This abstract class provides the foundation for all actor data types in the game, including visual elements, effects, models, and other interactive objects. It defines properties for positioning, scaling, attachment, and other common actor characteristics that are used by the actor system to create and manage actors.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.IsTransient
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether actors created from this data are transient (temporary).
member.remarks: Transient actors are typically short-lived effects or animations that don't persist and may be cleaned up more aggressively by the system.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.Socket
member.summary: Gets or sets the socket name for attachment points on the parent actor.
member.remarks: When specified, the actor will attach to a named socket on its parent actor, allowing for precise positioning relative to specific attachment points.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation offset applied to the actor.
member.remarks: This rotation is applied in addition to any inherited rotation from parent actors, unless is set to false.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.InheritRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the actor should inherit rotation from its parent.
member.remarks: When true (default), the actor will apply its parent's rotation in addition to its own. When false, only the actor's local rotation is used.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the position offset applied to the actor relative to its attachment point.
member.remarks: This offset is applied after any parent transformations and socket positioning.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.InheritScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the actor should inherit scale from its parent.
member.remarks: When true, the actor will be affected by its parent's scale transformations.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.AutoScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the actor should automatically scale based on its scope.
member.remarks: This is similar to but specifically inherits scale from the actor scope rather than just the immediate parent.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets a uniform scale factor applied to the actor.
member.remarks: This scale is applied to all dimensions of the actor. Use for non-uniform scaling along different axes.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.ScaleVector
member.summary: Gets or sets a non-uniform scale vector applied to the actor.
member.remarks: This allows different scaling factors for X, Y, and Z axes. If both and are specified, they are combined.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.AttachForwardOnce
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the actor should face forward once when attached.
member.remarks: When true, the actor will be oriented to face forward relative to its attachment point at the time of attachment, but won't continue to update its facing afterward.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.MiniMapIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimap icon configuration for this actor, if any.
member.remarks: When specified, the actor will appear on the minimap with the configured icon and properties.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.ParentRemovalProcedure
member.summary: Gets or sets the procedure to follow when the actor's parent is removed.
member.remarks: This determines how the actor should behave when its parent actor is destroyed or removed, such as whether to also be destroyed, detached, or remain in place.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.ReleaseOnGC
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the actor should be released during garbage collection.
member.remarks: When true, the actor's resources will be released during garbage collection cycles, which can help with memory management for frequently created and destroyed actors.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.AssetVolume
member.summary: Gets the volume dimensions of the actor's asset, if applicable.
member.remarks: This represents the 3D bounding box of the actor's visual representation. Base implementation returns null; derived classes may override for specific asset types.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.AssetRadius
member.summary: Gets the radius of the actor's asset, if applicable.
member.remarks: This represents the spherical bounding radius of the actor's visual representation. Base implementation returns null; derived classes may override for specific asset types.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActor.ViewActorAsyncType
member.summary: Gets the type of view actor used for client-side rendering.
member.remarks: This determines what kind of rendering actor will be created on the client side to display this actor. Default is the standard actor type.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorAdditionModel.CullHostMesh
member.summary: Determines whether the host mesh should be culled when the actor is attached to a host. This helps prevent rendering issues, such as overlapping meshes, when the host mesh is covered by the attached actor (e.g., a unit covered by cloth). Default value is false.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorMaterial.IntroDuration
member.summary: When the material is applied to a model, it will play the property animations from start to end within this duration.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorMaterial.OutroDuration
member.summary: When the material is removed from a model, it will play the property animations from end to start within this duration.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorSound.LoopCount
member.summary: Null stands for infinite loop.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorSound.Is2D
member.summary: The sound will be played in 2D space, which means it will not be affected by the camera position and rotation.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorSound.RolloffFactor
member.summary: Defines the rolloff factor for audio attenuation. A higher value indicates a steeper decrease in volume with distance. Only works when Is2D is false.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorSound.CutoffDistance
member.summary: Represents the distance beyond which the sound will be completely cut off. Only works when Is2D is false.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorSound.MaxInstanceCount
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of instances allowed. This is a hard limit based on sound link, and if exceeded, new instance will not be played, and if the sound is set to KillOnFinish, it will be killed.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorSound.MaxAudibleCount
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of audible instance allowed. This is a hard limit based on sound link, and if exceeded, the sound will be played, but it will not be audible.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Enum.ScopeAction
member.summary: 定义 Actor 作用域可以执行的操作类型
member.remarks: 这个枚举用于标识不同类型的作用域操作，这些操作影响作用域内 Actor 的行为和表现。 作用域操作通常在特定游戏事件或触发条件下执行。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Enum.ScopeAction.Normal
member.summary: 这是干啥的？忘记了。

member.name: F:GameCore.ActorSystem.Enum.ScopeAction.Impact
member.summary: 撞击操作 - 触发撞击效果和相关 Actor
member.remarks: 当执行此操作时，作用域会触发撞击相关的视觉效果、声音效果或其他 Actor。 通常用于碰撞检测、技能命中或其他需要产生撞击反馈的场景。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorAnimationPlayable
member.summary: 表示可以播放动画的Actor接口

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable
member.summary: Defines the interface for actors that support color-based visual effects.
member.remarks: IActorColorizable provides a standardized way to apply color effects to game actors, including temporary highlights and persistent tint colors. This supports selection indicators, status effects, damage indicators, spell effects, team colors, material adjustments, and other visual feedback mechanisms. The interface supports both static colors and animated color transitions, with the ability to layer multiple effects using weighted aggregation. All color effects use HDR (High Dynamic Range) colors for enhanced visual fidelity.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.HighlightAggregator
member.summary: Gets the arithmetic aggregator used to combine multiple highlight effects.
member.value: The aggregator that manages and blends multiple highlight colors, or null if not initialized.
member.remarks: The highlight aggregator combines multiple highlight effects using arithmetic blending operations. This allows for complex visual effects where multiple systems can contribute to the final highlight appearance simultaneously, such as selection + damage + spell effect highlights.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.AnimateHighlight(GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor,GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{GameCore.Animation.Enum.RepeatBehavior},System.Object,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an animated highlight transition between two specific colors.
member.param: The starting color of the highlight animation.
The ending color of the highlight animation.
The duration of the color transition.
Whether to automatically reverse the animation back to the starting color.
The repeat behavior for the animation (e.g., loop count, infinite).
Optional identifier for this highlight effect, used for later removal or modification.
The blending weight of this highlight relative to others (default: 1.0).
member.returns: The created animation object for controlling the highlight transition.
member.remarks: This method creates a smooth color transition animation for visual effects like pulsing damage indicators, charging spell effects, or selection feedback. The animation can be configured to loop, reverse, or play once. Multiple animations can run simultaneously with different weights affecting the final appearance.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.AnimateHighlight(GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{GameCore.Animation.Enum.RepeatBehavior},System.Object,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an animated highlight transition from the current color to a target color.
member.param: The target color for the highlight animation.
The duration of the color transition.
Whether to automatically reverse the animation back to the starting color.
The repeat behavior for the animation (e.g., loop count, infinite).
Optional identifier for this highlight effect, used for later removal or modification.
The blending weight of this highlight relative to others (default: 1.0).
member.returns: The created animation object for controlling the highlight transition.
member.remarks: This is a convenience method that animates from the current highlight state to the specified color. It's particularly useful for creating highlight effects that build upon existing highlights rather than replacing them entirely.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.ClearAllHighlights
member.summary: Removes all highlight effects from this actor.
member.remarks: This method clears all active highlight effects, including both static highlights and running animations. It effectively resets the actor to its default appearance. Use this when you need to completely clear all visual highlighting effects.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.ClearHighlight(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes a specific highlight effect identified by its key.
member.param: The identifier of the highlight effect to remove.
member.remarks: This method removes only the highlight effect associated with the specified key, leaving other highlight effects intact. This allows for selective removal of specific effects while maintaining others, such as removing a damage indicator while keeping a selection highlight active.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.InitializeHighlightAggregator
member.summary: Initializes the highlight aggregator system for this actor.
member.remarks: This method must be called before using any highlight functionality. It sets up the internal systems needed to manage and blend multiple highlight effects. After calling this method, the HighlightAggregator property will be non-null and ready for use.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.SetHighlight(GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor,System.Object,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets a static highlight color for this actor.
member.param: The highlight color to apply.
Optional identifier for this highlight effect.
The blending weight of this highlight relative to others (default: 1.0).
member.remarks: This method applies a static (non-animated) highlight color to the actor. Unlike animated highlights, static highlights remain constant until explicitly changed or removed. Multiple static highlights can be applied simultaneously and will be blended together based on their weights.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.TintColorAggregators
member.summary: Gets the arithmetic aggregators used to combine multiple tint color effects for different texture layers.
member.value: A dictionary mapping layer indices to their respective aggregators, or null if not initialized.
member.remarks: The tint color system supports multiple texture layers, allowing selective coloring of different parts of the model. Each layer has its own arithmetic aggregator that combines multiple tint effects using arithmetic blending operations. Layer 0 represents the default layer that affects the entire model texture. Models can be configured with custom layer indices to enable selective coloring of specific texture regions.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.AnimateTintColor(GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor,GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{GameCore.Animation.Enum.RepeatBehavior},System.Object,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an animated tint color transition between two specific colors on a specific layer.
member.param: The starting color of the tint animation.
The ending color of the tint animation.
The texture layer index to apply the tint to (default: 0 for entire model).
The duration of the color transition.
Whether to automatically reverse the animation back to the starting color.
The repeat behavior for the animation (e.g., loop count, infinite).
Optional identifier for this tint effect, used for later removal or modification.
The blending weight of this tint relative to others (default: 1.0).
member.returns: The created animation object for controlling the tint transition.
member.remarks: This method creates smooth tint color animations for effects like health status changes, team color transitions, or environmental lighting effects. Tint animations are persistent and typically used for gradual state changes rather than immediate visual feedback. Different layers allow selective coloring of model texture regions.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.AnimateTintColor(GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{GameCore.Animation.Enum.RepeatBehavior},System.Object,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an animated tint color transition from the current color to a target color on a specific layer.
member.param: The target color for the tint animation.
The texture layer index to apply the tint to (default: 0 for entire model).
The duration of the color transition.
Whether to automatically reverse the animation back to the starting color.
The repeat behavior for the animation (e.g., loop count, infinite).
Optional identifier for this tint effect, used for later removal or modification.
The blending weight of this tint relative to others (default: 1.0).
member.returns: The created animation object for controlling the tint transition.
member.remarks: This convenience method animates from the current tint state to the specified color on a specific layer. It's useful for creating smooth transitions when changing team colors, status indicators, or other persistent color effects. Different layers allow selective coloring of model texture regions.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.ClearTintColor
member.summary: Completely disables all tint color effects on all layers for this actor.
member.remarks: This method clears all active tint color effects across all texture layers, including both static tints and running animations. It completely resets the actor's tint colors to their default state on all layers. Use this when you need to completely clear all persistent color modifications across the entire model.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.ResetTintColorByLayer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resets tint color effects on a specific layer to their default state.
member.param: The texture layer index to reset (default: 0 for entire model).
member.remarks: This method removes all tint color effects from the specified layer, including both static tints and running animations, while leaving other layers intact. This allows for selective reset of specific texture regions while maintaining color effects on other parts of the model.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.ClearTintColorByKey(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a specific tint color effect identified by its key from a specific layer.
member.param: The identifier of the tint color effect to remove.
The texture layer index to modify (default: 0 for entire model).
member.remarks: This method removes only the tint color effect associated with the specified key from the specified layer, leaving other tint effects intact. This allows for selective removal of specific color modifications while maintaining others, such as removing a health status tint while keeping team color active.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.InitializeTintColorAggregators
member.summary: Initializes the tint color aggregator system for this actor.
member.remarks: This method must be called before using any tint color functionality. It sets up the internal systems needed to manage and blend multiple tint color effects across different layers. After calling this method, the TintColorAggregators property will be non-null and ready for use.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.SetTintColor(GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets a static tint color for this actor on a specific layer.
member.param: The tint color to apply.
The texture layer index to apply the tint to (default: 0 for entire model).
Optional identifier for this tint effect.
The blending weight of this tint relative to others (default: 1.0).
member.remarks: This method applies a static (non-animated) tint color to the specified layer of the actor. Tint colors are persistent modifications that remain active until explicitly changed or removed. Multiple tint colors can be applied simultaneously and will be blended together based on their weights. Different layers allow selective coloring of model texture regions. Common uses include team colors, health status indicators, and material property adjustments.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.InitializeColorAggregators
member.summary: Initializes both highlight and tint color aggregator systems for this actor.
member.remarks: This convenience method initializes both color effect systems in one call. It's equivalent to calling both InitializeHighlightAggregator() and InitializeTintColorAggregators(). After calling this method, both aggregator properties will be non-null and ready for use.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorColorizable.ClearAllColorEffects
member.summary: Removes all color effects from this actor, including both highlights and tint colors.
member.remarks: This method clears all active color effects, resetting the actor to its default appearance. It's equivalent to calling both ClearAllHighlights() and ClearTintColor(). Use this for complete visual reset or when changing contexts that require clean state.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorPlayable
member.summary: Defines an interface for actors that can be played, controlled, or have their playback speed adjusted.
member.remarks: This interface extends basic actor functionality to support playback control, typically used for animations, effects, or other time-based actors that can be started, stopped, or have their timing modified. It's commonly implemented by actors that contain animations or sequences.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope
member.summary: 定义 Actor 作用域接口，管理一组相关 Actor 的生命周期和行为
member.remarks: Actor 作用域是一个容器，用于管理一组逻辑上相关的 Actor 对象。它提供了统一的 生命周期管理、可见性控制、动作执行等功能。作用域可以是瞬态的或持久的，并支持 在客户端和服务端之间的同步。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.Id
member.summary: 获取作用域的唯一标识符

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.Context
member.summary: 获取作用域的上下文信息
member.remarks: 上下文包含作用域的配置、父级信息、以及其他运行时状态。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.MainActor
member.summary: 获取作用域的主要 Actor（如果存在）
member.remarks: 主要 Actor 通常是作用域的核心对象，其他 Actor 可能围绕它进行操作。 对于作用域拥有者，返回其自身作用域的同步 Actor。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.Host
member.summary: 获取作用域的宿主 Actor
member.remarks: 宿主 Actor 是承载此作用域的父级 Actor，通常用于确定作用域的位置和变换。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.IsTransient
member.summary: 获取一个值，指示作用域是否为瞬态
member.remarks: 瞬态作用域通常用于临时效果，生命周期较短，而非瞬态作用域则用于持久对象。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.ImpactActors
member.summary: 获取撞击时要创建的 Actor 数据链接列表
member.remarks: 当执行撞击操作时，这些 Actor 将被创建并添加到作用域中，通常用于视觉效果或音效。

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.Kill
member.summary: 终止作用域，播放死亡动画并执行清理
member.remarks: 与 不同，此方法会播放适当的死亡动画和效果。

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.Destroy
member.summary: 销毁作用域和其中的所有 Actor，不播放死亡动画

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.IsVisibleTo(GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: 检查作用域是否对指定玩家可见
member.param: 要检查的玩家
member.returns: 如果对玩家可见则返回 true；否则返回 false

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.IsVisibleToTransient(GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: 检查瞬态作用域是否对指定玩家可见
member.param: 要检查的玩家
member.returns: 如果瞬态作用域对玩家可见则返回 true；否则返回 false

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope.SendAction(GameCore.ActorSystem.Enum.ScopeAction)
member.summary: 向作用域发送指定的操作命令
member.param: 要执行的作用域操作
member.remarks: 此方法会将操作广播给所有可见的客户端，触发相应的视觉或行为效果。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext
member.summary: 定义 Actor 作用域上下文接口，提供作用域运行所需的环境信息和配置
member.remarks: 作用域上下文包含了作用域运行所需的所有环境信息，包括目标、来源、配置数据、 位置信息、缩放参数等。它为作用域的创建和管理提供了统一的数据访问接口。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.IsValid
member.summary: 获取一个值，指示此上下文是否有效
member.remarks: 当目标和来源都不为 null 时，上下文被认为是有效的。 此属性使用 MemberNotNullWhen 特性来提供编译时的空值检查保证。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.IsTransient
member.summary: 获取一个值，指示此上下文是否为瞬态
member.remarks: 瞬态上下文通常用于临时效果和短期存在的作用域。 默认返回 false，派生类可以重写此属性以提供不同的行为。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Target
member.summary: 获取作用域的目标对象
member.remarks: 目标对象是作用域操作的主要对象，通常决定了作用域的位置和行为。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Source
member.summary: 获取作用域的来源对象
member.remarks: 默认情况下，来源对象与目标对象相同。派生类可以重写此属性以提供不同的来源。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Link
member.summary: 获取作用域拥有者的数据链接
member.remarks: 此链接指向定义作用域行为和配置的数据对象。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.OverrideLink
member.summary: 获取作用域覆盖配置的数据链接
member.remarks: 覆盖链接可以提供特殊的配置来修改作用域的默认行为。 默认返回 null，表示没有覆盖配置。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Cache
member.summary: 获取缓存的作用域拥有者数据
member.remarks: 从数据链接中获取的实际配置数据，用于作用域的行为定义。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Player
member.summary: 获取拥有此作用域的玩家
member.remarks: 用于确定作用域的所有权和权限管理。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Scale
member.summary: 获取作用域的缩放因子
member.remarks: 用于调整作用域中 Actor 的整体大小。如果为 null，则使用默认缩放。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Volume
member.summary: 获取作用域的体积参数
member.remarks: 用于 3D 缩放计算，定义作用域在三个维度上的大小。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Radius
member.summary: 获取作用域的半径参数
member.remarks: 用于径向缩放计算。默认返回 null，派生类可以重写以提供半径信息。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Position
member.summary: 获取作用域在场景中的位置
member.remarks: 基于目标对象的位置确定作用域的空间坐标。如果上下文无效，会抛出异常。
member.exception: 当上下文无效时抛出

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Host
member.summary: 获取作用域的宿主 Actor
member.remarks: 宿主 Actor 用于作用域的附加和位置同步。通常是目标对象的同步 Actor 接口。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.Facing
member.summary: 获取作用域的朝向角度
member.remarks: 定义作用域在空间中的旋转方向，影响其中 Actor 的排列和朝向。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext.ImpactActors
member.summary: 获取撞击时要创建的 Actor 列表
member.remarks: 优先使用覆盖配置中的撞击 Actor，如果没有覆盖则使用缓存配置中的撞击 Actor。 这些 Actor 会在执行撞击操作时被创建和管理。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeOwner
member.summary: 定义 Actor 作用域拥有者接口，管理和创建作用域实例
member.remarks: 作用域拥有者负责管理其关联的 Actor 作用域的生命周期，包括创建、初始化和维护作用域。 它决定何时需要创建作用域，以及创建何种类型的作用域（瞬态或持久）。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeOwner.SelfScope
member.summary: 获取自身作为作用域的实例
member.remarks: 当对象本身就是一个作用域时，返回自身的作用域接口；否则返回 null。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeOwner.ActorScope
member.summary: 获取或设置关联的 Actor 作用域
member.remarks: 存储由此拥有者创建和管理的作用域实例。内部设置器允许系统管理作用域的分配。

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeOwner.ShouldCreateScope
member.summary: 获取一个值，指示是否应该创建作用域
member.remarks: 当存在需要管理的 Actor 数组或撞击 Actor 时返回 true，表示需要创建作用域来管理这些对象。

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeOwner.InitializeActorScope
member.summary: 初始化 Actor 作用域，如果尚未存在则创建新的作用域
member.returns: 初始化后的作用域实例，如果初始化失败则返回 null
member.remarks: 此方法检查是否已存在作用域，如果不存在且需要创建，则会创建新的作用域实例。 它优先返回自身作用域，然后根据需要创建新的作用域。

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeOwner.CreateActorScope
member.summary: 创建新的 Actor 作用域实例
member.returns: 新创建的作用域实例
member.remarks: 根据作用域的类型（瞬态或持久）创建相应的作用域实例。 瞬态作用域用于临时的一次性效果，持久作用域用于长期存在的对象。

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorTimelineAsset
member.summary: Stands for actors that have timeline lifespan, and can trigger timed events, such as sounds.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor
member.summary: Represents the base class for all actors in the game world, providing visual representation and interactive capabilities.
member.remarks: Actors are objects that can be displayed on the client side within the game world, such as effects, models, animations, sounds, and other visual elements. They are managed by actor scopes and can be attached to entities or other actors to create complex visual hierarchies. Actors can be transient (temporary) or persistent based on their configuration and scope.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor.Player
member.summary: Gets or sets the player that owns this actor.
member.remarks: If no player is explicitly set, the actor will use the player from its scope context or fall back to the default player.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the actor scope that manages this actor's lifecycle and context.
member.remarks: The scope provides context information such as position, targets, and other actors within the same logical group. This property is managed internally by the scope system.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor.Context
member.summary: Gets the context information from the actor's scope, if available.
member.remarks: The context provides access to targets, position, scale, and other environmental information that affects how the actor behaves and appears.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent actor in the attachment hierarchy.
member.value: Have to be set via AttachTo, cannot be set directly.
member.remarks: The parent relationship determines visual hierarchy and can affect transformations like position, rotation, and scale inheritance. Use the AttachTo method to establish parent-child relationships between actors.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor.IsTransient
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this actor is transient (temporary).
member.remarks: Transient actors are typically short-lived effects or animations that are not persisted and may be cleaned up more aggressively. Transient actors are often fire and forget, they will kill themselves after they are done playing 'OneShot' animations/effects/sounds. While persistent actors are designed to be long-lived and persistent, they will have to be killed manually. This value is determined by the actor's data configuration and its scope settings.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor.DisposeUnmanaged(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Only destroy the view actor when not finalizing.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor.HasDelayedInitialization
member.summary: Some actor will need to wait for 1 tick to Initialize.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this unit including its type and friendly name.
member.returns: A formatted string describing this unit.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorBeam
member.summary: Represents a beam effect actor that renders directional visual effects like lasers, lightning, or energy beams.
member.remarks: ActorBeam is specialized for creating linear visual effects that typically extend from one point to another. Common uses include laser beams, lightning bolts, energy rays, magical beams, and other directional effects. It implements IActorPlayable to support playback control and can be configured for automatic playback. The beam actor integrates with the game's visual effects system and supports various timing controls, though speed adjustment may have limitations depending on the beam type.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorBeam.#ctor(GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorBeam},System.Boolean,GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope,GameCore.SceneSystem.Scene,GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Represents a beam effect actor that renders directional visual effects like lasers, lightning, or energy beams.
member.remarks: ActorBeam is specialized for creating linear visual effects that typically extend from one point to another. Common uses include laser beams, lightning bolts, energy rays, magical beams, and other directional effects. It implements IActorPlayable to support playback control and can be configured for automatic playback. The beam actor integrates with the game's visual effects system and supports various timing controls, though speed adjustment may have limitations depending on the beam type.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorHighlight
member.summary: Represents an actor that provides highlighting effects for other actors, typically used for selection, targeting, or status indication.
member.remarks: ActorHighlight is a specialized actor that attaches to other actors to provide visual highlighting effects. It integrates with the highlight aggregation system to create smooth color transitions and animations. The highlight can be configured with different colors, durations, and animation behaviors such as auto-reverse and repeat patterns. This is commonly used for UI feedback, target selection, and status visualization.
member.param: The game data link defining the configuration for this highlight actor.
Whether to skip birth animations or effects.
The actor scope that will manage this actor's lifecycle.
The scene to create the actor in, if different from the scope's scene.
Optional player to override the default player assignment.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorHighlight.#ctor(GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorHighlight},System.Boolean,GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope,GameCore.SceneSystem.Scene,GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Represents an actor that provides highlighting effects for other actors, typically used for selection, targeting, or status indication.
member.remarks: ActorHighlight is a specialized actor that attaches to other actors to provide visual highlighting effects. It integrates with the highlight aggregation system to create smooth color transitions and animations. The highlight can be configured with different colors, durations, and animation behaviors such as auto-reverse and repeat patterns. This is commonly used for UI feedback, target selection, and status visualization.
member.param: The game data link defining the configuration for this highlight actor.
Whether to skip birth animations or effects.
The actor scope that will manage this actor's lifecycle.
The scene to create the actor in, if different from the scope's scene.
Optional player to override the default player assignment.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorModel
member.summary: Represents a 3D model actor that can be displayed in the game world.
member.remarks: ActorModel is used to render 3D models, meshes, and other geometric objects in the game. It supports highlighting effects and integrates with the actor management system for lifecycle control. The model actor can be either transient (temporary) or persistent based on its configuration and intended usage.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorModel.#ctor(GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorModel},System.Boolean,GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope,GameCore.SceneSystem.Scene,GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ActorModel class with the specified configuration.
member.param: The game data link defining the configuration for this model actor.
Whether to skip birth animations or effects.
The actor scope that will manage this actor's lifecycle.
The scene to create the actor in, if different from the scope's scene.
Optional player to override the default player assignment.
member.remarks: On the client side, non-transient model actors are registered in a global lookup for efficient retrieval and management. This registration is automatically handled during construction and cleaned up during disposal.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorParticle
member.summary: Represents a particle effect actor that can display particle systems and visual effects in the game world.
member.remarks: ActorParticle is designed to render particle effects such as explosions, magic spells, environmental effects, and other visual phenomena. It implements IActorPlayable to support playback control and can be configured for automatic playback. The particle actor integrates with the game's visual effects system and supports various timing and animation controls.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorParticle.#ctor(GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorParticle},System.Boolean,GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope,GameCore.SceneSystem.Scene,GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ActorParticle class with the specified configuration.
member.param: The game data link defining the configuration for this particle actor.
Whether to skip birth animations or effects.
The actor scope that will manage this actor's lifecycle.
The scene to create the actor in, if different from the scope's scene.
Optional player to override the default player assignment.
member.remarks: On the client side, non-transient particle actors are registered in a global lookup for efficient retrieval and management. This registration is automatically handled during construction and cleaned up during disposal.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope
member.summary: Represents a scope that manages a group of actors sharing the same context and lifecycle.
member.param: The context information that defines the scope's environment and parameters.
member.remarks: Actor scopes provide a way to group related actors together and manage their collective lifecycle. They maintain context information such as position, targets, visibility, and other shared properties that affect all actors within the scope. Scopes can be transient (temporary) or persistent based on their intended usage patterns.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.#ctor(GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScopeContext)
member.summary: Represents a scope that manages a group of actors sharing the same context and lifecycle.
member.param: The context information that defines the scope's environment and parameters.
member.remarks: Actor scopes provide a way to group related actors together and manage their collective lifecycle. They maintain context information such as position, targets, visibility, and other shared properties that affect all actors within the scope. Scopes can be transient (temporary) or persistent based on their intended usage patterns.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this actor scope.
member.remarks: By default, this returns the hash code of the scope instance. Derived classes may override this to provide more specific identification logic.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.Context
member.summary: Gets the context information that defines this scope's environment and parameters.
member.remarks: The context provides information such as position, targets, player ownership, scale, and other environmental factors that affect actors within this scope.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.Host
member.summary: Gets the host object that owns this actor scope, if any.
member.remarks: The host is typically an entity or other object that serves as the primary owner or anchor point for the actors managed by this scope.

member.name: P:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.GameCore#ActorSystem#IActorScope#MainActor
member.summary: Gets the main actor for this scope. Base implementation returns null.
member.remarks: Some specialized scopes may designate a primary actor that represents the scope's main visual element. The base ActorScope does not define a main actor.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.Kill
member.summary: Terminates all actors in this scope and marks the scope for cleanup.
member.remarks: This method should be implemented by derived classes to define how actors are terminated when the scope is being shut down.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.GameCore#ActorSystem#IActorScope#Destroy
member.summary: Destroys this actor scope and cleans up its resources.
member.remarks: This method is called when the scope needs to be completely removed from the game. It delegates to the virtual Destroy method to allow customization by derived classes.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.IsVisibleTo(GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Determines whether this scope is visible to the specified player.
member.param: The player to check visibility for.
member.returns: true if the scope is visible to the player; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method must be implemented by derived classes to define visibility rules for server-side actor management and network synchronization.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.IsVisibleToTransient(GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Determines whether this scope is visible to the specified player for transient operations.
member.param: The player to check transient visibility for.
member.returns: true if the scope is visible for transient operations; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Transient visibility may have different rules than regular visibility, often used for temporary effects or short-lived actors.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.Add(GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor)
member.summary: Adds an actor to this scope.
member.param: The actor to add to the scope.
member.returns: true if the actor was successfully added; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: An actor can only belong to one scope at a time. If the actor is already assigned to another scope, this method will return false.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorScope.Remove(GameCore.ActorSystem.Actor)
member.summary: Removes an actor from this scope.
member.param: The actor to remove from the scope.
member.remarks: If the actor belongs to this scope, it will be unassigned and no longer managed by this scope. Actors from other scopes are ignored.

member.name: T:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorSegmented
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for segmented actors that can display directional effects such as beams, projectiles, or area indicators.
member.remarks: Segmented actors are special visual effects that extend from one point to another, often used for spells, projectiles, beams, or area-of-effect indicators. They consist of multiple segments that can be arranged in a line, with optional launch and impact effects at the endpoints. The actor automatically calculates its orientation and length based on the positions of its start and end points.

member.name: M:GameCore.ActorSystem.ActorSegmented.#ctor(GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.ActorSystem.Data.GameDataActorSegmented},System.Boolean,GameCore.ActorSystem.IActorScope,GameCore.SceneSystem.Scene,GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ActorSegmented class on the server side.
member.param: The game data link defining the configuration for this segmented actor.
Whether to skip birth animations or effects.
The actor scope that will manage this actor's lifecycle.

member.name: M:GameCore.AISystem.AIThinkTree.IsCasting
member.summary: 判断AI单位是否正在施法中，用于AI行为决策。
member.returns: 如果单位正在施法则返回true，否则返回false。

remarks.para: 施法判断标准：

item.description: 只考虑非自动获取的指令（忽略自动施法和连续施法）
指令阶段必须达到Preswing或更后阶段
不包含Approach和WaitForCooldown阶段

remarks.para: 设计原理：

item.description: Approach阶段：单位仍在移动，可以被其他行为打断，不算真正的"施法"
WaitForCooldown阶段：单位在等待技能冷却，此时AI可以进行其他决策（如移动、观察）
Preswing及之后：单位已开始施法动作，应该专注完成当前技能，避免AI行为冲突

remarks.para: 注意：当前执行顺序为 Approach → WaitForCooldown → Preswing → Cast → Channel → Backswing

member.name: T:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeParallel
member.summary:
并行节点
同时执行所有子节点，根据成功/失败策略决定整体结果

remarks.para: 执行逻辑：

item.description: 同时执行所有子节点（不考虑执行顺序）
根据成功策略和失败策略决定整体结果
即使某些子节点失败，其他子节点仍会继续执行

remarks.para: 成功策略：

item.description: ：任意一个子节点成功即返回成功
：所有子节点都成功才返回成功

remarks.para: 失败策略：

item.description: ：任意一个子节点失败即返回失败
：所有子节点都失败才返回失败

remarks.para: 使用场景：

item.description: 同时监听多个条件（如血量低 OR 敌人接近）
并行执行多个独立的AI行为
同时尝试多种策略
复合条件检查（如移动 AND 攻击）

remarks.para: 与其他节点的区别：

item.description: ：顺序尝试，任一成功就停止
：顺序执行，任一失败就停止
：并行执行，根据策略决定结果

member.name: P:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeParallel.Nodes
member.summary:
子节点列表
所有节点将同时执行，不考虑列表顺序

member.name: P:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeParallel.SuccessPolicy
member.summary:
成功策略
决定什么情况下并行节点返回成功
member.value:
：任意一个子节点成功即返回成功（默认）
：所有子节点都成功才返回成功

member.name: P:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeParallel.FailurePolicy
member.summary:
失败策略
决定什么情况下并行节点返回失败
member.value:
：任意一个子节点失败即返回失败
：所有子节点都失败才返回失败（默认）

member.name: M:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeParallel.Think(GameCore.AISystem.AIThinkTree)
member.summary:
执行并行节点逻辑
同时执行所有子节点，根据成功/失败策略决定整体结果
member.param: AI思考树实例
member.returns: 根据成功策略和失败策略，以及子节点执行结果决定的最终结果

member.name: T:GameCore.AISystem.Data.ParallelPolicy
member.summary:
并行节点策略枚举
定义并行节点如何处理子节点的成功/失败条件

member.name: F:GameCore.AISystem.Data.ParallelPolicy.RequireOne
member.summary:
要求一个：任意一个子节点满足条件即可
用于成功策略时：任一成功即成功
用于失败策略时：任一失败即失败

member.name: F:GameCore.AISystem.Data.ParallelPolicy.RequireAll
member.summary:
要求全部：所有子节点都必须满足条件
用于成功策略时：全部成功才成功
用于失败策略时：全部失败才失败

member.name: T:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeSelect
member.summary: 选择节点 任意一个子节点返回Ok则返回Ok，否则返回错误

member.name: T:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeSequence
member.summary:
序列节点
依次执行所有子节点，所有子节点都返回Ok才返回Ok，任何一个失败则立即返回错误

remarks.para: 执行逻辑：

item.description: 按顺序执行每个子节点
如果某个子节点返回失败，立即停止执行并返回该错误
只有当所有子节点都成功时，才返回成功

remarks.para: 使用场景：

item.description: 实现"先A然后B然后C"的顺序逻辑
组合多个必须按顺序完成的动作
例如：扫描敌人 → 设置焦点 → 施法攻击

remarks.para: 与Select节点的区别：

item.description: ：任意一个成功就返回成功（OR逻辑）
：所有节点都必须成功才返回成功（AND逻辑）

member.name: T:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeValidateFocus
member.summary:
AI节点：设置焦点目标
用于AI系统中设置或清除当前的焦点目标。焦点目标通常用于AI的持续关注和决策。

remarks.para: 目标处理：

item.description: 如果指定了目标，将该目标设置为AI的焦点目标
如果目标为空，将清除当前的焦点目标（设置为null）
这种设计允许AI在不同情况下灵活地管理注意力

remarks.para: 使用场景：

item.description: 设置优先攻击目标
标记需要持续关注的敌人
清除过期或无效的焦点目标

member.name: P:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeValidateFocus.Target
member.summary:
获取焦点目标的函数
如果返回null，将清除当前焦点目标；如果返回有效实体，将设置为新的焦点目标。
member.value:
用于确定焦点目标的函数。函数可以返回：
- 清除当前焦点目标
有效的 - 设置为新的焦点目标

member.name: M:GameCore.AISystem.Data.GameDataAINodeValidateFocus.Actions(GameCore.AISystem.AIThinkTree)
member.summary: 执行焦点设置操作
member.param: AI思考树实例
member.returns: 始终返回 ，因为焦点设置操作总是可以执行的， 无论是设置新目标还是清除现有目标。

remarks.para: 该方法的执行逻辑：

item.description: 通过 函数获取目标实体
如果没有指定 函数，使用
将获取的目标（可能为null）设置为
返回成功结果

remarks.para: 注意：即使目标为null也被视为成功操作，因为这代表"清除焦点目标"的有效指令。

member.name: T:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for timeline-based animations that can be played, reversed, and repeated over time.
member.remarks: TimelineAnimation provides a framework for creating time-based animations that integrate with the game's tick system and async/await patterns. It supports various playback modes including auto-reverse, repeat counts, and duration-based repetition. Derived classes implement the specific animation logic by overriding the Update method.
member.param: Optional time adjustment in milliseconds to apply to the animation start time.
