member.name: P:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.IsInReverse
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the animation is currently playing in reverse.
member.value: True if the animation is playing backwards; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is automatically managed when AutoReverse is enabled. When the animation reaches the end of its duration, it will reverse direction if AutoReverse is true.

member.name: P:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.CurrentCount
member.summary: Gets the current repeat count of the animation.
member.value: The number of times the animation has completed its cycle.
member.remarks: This value increments each time the animation completes a full cycle. For auto-reversing animations, a complete cycle includes both forward and reverse playback.

member.name: P:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.AutoReverse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the animation should automatically reverse direction when it reaches the end.
member.value: True to enable auto-reverse; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When enabled, the animation will play forward to the end, then backward to the beginning, creating a ping-pong effect. This counts as one complete cycle for repeat behavior purposes.

member.name: P:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of one animation cycle.
member.value: The time span representing the duration of a single animation cycle.
member.remarks: This defines how long it takes for the animation to complete one forward playback. For auto-reversing animations, the total cycle time is twice this duration.

member.name: P:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.RepeatBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the repeat behavior that controls how the animation repeats.
member.value: A RepeatBehavior value specifying the repetition pattern.
member.remarks: This can be set to a specific count, a duration, or forever. The default is 1, meaning the animation plays once and then stops.

member.name: P:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.AdjustByFrameDelta
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether adjustments should be applied relative to the frame delta time. Basically, if you want to use the game tick or real time. Animation that may affect the game state should use false, while animations that are purely visual can use true.
member.value: True to use real frame delta time; false to use fixed game tick time.
member.remarks: Animations that may affect the game state should use false for consistent timing, while animations that are purely visual can use true for smoother real-time playback.

member.name: M:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.Pause(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pauses or resumes the animation playback.
member.param: True to pause the animation; false to resume it.
member.remarks: When paused, the animation will stop advancing and remain at its current position. This method has no effect if the animation has already completed.

member.name: M:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result value of the animation when it completes.
member.returns: The final time value of the animation, depending on the repeat behavior.
member.remarks: For duration-based repeat behavior, returns the remaining total time. For other behaviors, returns the current time position, accounting for reverse playback.

member.name: M:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Advances the animation by the specified time delta.
member.param: The time delta since the last update in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This method is called automatically by the thinking system. It updates the animation's time position, handles direction changes for auto-reverse, and calls the Update method for derived classes to implement their specific animation logic.

member.name: M:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.Update(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the animation state based on the current time position.
member.param: The current time position in the animation in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to define the specific animation behavior. It is called every frame while the animation is active.

member.name: M:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.Cancel(GameCore.Animation.Enum.CancelBehavior)
member.summary: Cancels the animation with the specified cancellation behavior.
member.param: The behavior to apply when cancelling the animation.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to define how the animation should handle cancellation, such as jumping to the end state or holding the current state.

member.name: M:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the animation should finish based on its repeat behavior and current state.
member.returns: True if the animation should complete; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method handles the complex logic for determining animation completion based on repeat behavior, auto-reverse settings, and current cycle counts.

member.name: M:GameCore.Animation.TimelineAnimation.Start
member.summary: Starts the animation and initializes its state.
member.remarks: This method sets up the initial animation state including time position, duration, and repeat behavior configuration. It then calls the base Start method to begin execution.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IAttachedObject`1
member.summary: AttachedObject Fact Check 1. Apply Modification on activation - ok 2. Remove Modification on deactivation and removal - ok 3. Apply Modification on stack change - ok 4. StackParam enable and removal per instance - ok 5. Create actors on link enabled - TODO 6. Destroy actors on link disabled - TODO 7. Apply unit states and immunity on link attached - ok 8. Remove unit states and immunity on link detached - ok 9. Apply Category and Link disable on link attached - ok 10. Remove Category and Link disable on link detached - ok

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IAttachedObject`2
member.summary: IAttachedObject that has a manager on the host.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IAttachedObject`2.OnAttached
member.summary: Called when the object is successfully attached to its host.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICommandTarget
member.summary: Defines an interface for objects that can be targeted by commands in the game.
member.remarks: This interface serves as a marker for objects that can receive command-based interactions from players, AI, or other game systems. It's used in conjunction with the command and targeting systems to identify valid command recipients.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost
member.summary: Defines the interface for objects that can host cooldowns and manage attached objects with synchronization support.
member.remarks: ICooldownHost extends ICooldownOwner and IPropertyHost to provide a comprehensive hosting environment for objects that need to manage cooldowns, properties, and attached child objects. This interface is typically implemented by entities and units that serve as containers for abilities, items, and other game components. It handles synchronization of attached objects between server and client, maintains registration for lookup purposes, and provides property-based storage for complex data structures. The interface supports the attachment system used throughout the game for abilities, items, effects, and other dynamic components.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.GetById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a cooldown host by its unique identifier.
member.param: The unique identifier of the view actor associated with the host.
member.returns: The cooldown host with the specified ID, or null if not found.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.GameCore#BaseInterface#ICooldownOwner#CooldownHost
member.summary: Gets the cooldown host for this cooldown owner (returns itself).
member.value: This instance as the cooldown host.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.GetBySyncId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves an attached object by its synchronization identifier.
member.param: The synchronization ID of the attached object to retrieve.
member.returns: The attached object with the specified sync ID, or null if not found.
member.remarks: This method provides fast lookup of attached objects by their unique synchronization identifiers, which are used for network synchronization and cross-reference operations.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.Register
member.summary: Registers this cooldown host in the global lookup table.
member.returns: True if registration was successful; otherwise, throws an exception.
member.exception: Thrown when the registration ID conflicts with an existing host.
member.remarks: Registration enables global lookup of this host by its view actor ID, which is essential for network synchronization and cross-object references. Each host must have a unique ID.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.Unregister
member.summary: Unregisters this cooldown host from the global lookup table.
member.returns: True if unregistration was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Unregistration should be called during host disposal to prevent memory leaks and ensure proper cleanup of global references.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.ViewActor
member.summary: Gets the core actor that represents this host in the engine.
member.value: The view actor associated with this cooldown host.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.LazyAttachedChildren
member.summary: Gets the lazy-initialized dictionary of attached child objects.
member.value: A lazy-initialized dictionary for efficient memory usage when no children are attached.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.AttachedChildren
member.summary: Gets the dictionary of attached child objects, creating it if necessary.
member.value: The dictionary containing all attached objects indexed by their sync IDs.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.DisposeAttachedChildrenPool
member.summary: Disposes all attached child objects and cleans up the attachment pool.
member.remarks: This method is called during host disposal to ensure all attached objects are properly destroyed and their resources are released. It only disposes children if the lazy collection has been initialized.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.AddAttached(GameCore.BaseInterface.IAttachedObject)
member.summary: Adds an attached object to this host's collection of children.
member.param: The attached object to add.
member.returns: True if the object was successfully added; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method handles the registration of attached objects and their synchronization setup. Only synchronized objects can be added, and each object must have a unique sync ID within the host. On the server, this also triggers network synchronization to inform clients of the new attachment.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.RemoveAttached(GameCore.BaseInterface.IAttachedObject)
member.summary: Removes an attached object from this host's collection of children.
member.param: The attached object to remove.
member.returns: True if the object was successfully removed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method handles the deregistration of attached objects and cleanup of synchronization data. On the server, it also triggers network synchronization to inform clients of the removal.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.SyncIds
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of synchronization ID lists for different properties.
member.value: A dictionary mapping property types to sets of synchronization IDs.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.GetSyncIdList(GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum)
member.summary: Retrieves or creates a synchronization ID list for the specified property.
member.param: The property to get the sync ID list for.
member.returns: A set of synchronization IDs associated with the property.
member.remarks: This method manages synchronized lists of object IDs for properties, enabling efficient synchronization of collections between server and client. Lists are created on demand and populated from network data on the client side.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.SyncIdListAdd(GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum,GameCore.BaseInterface.IAttachedObject)
member.summary: Adds an attached object to a synchronized property list.
member.param: The property to add the object to.
The attached object to add.
member.remarks: This method adds the object's sync ID to the specified property list and triggers network synchronization on the server to inform clients of the change.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost.SyncIdListRemove(GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum,GameCore.BaseInterface.IAttachedObject)
member.summary: Removes an attached object from a synchronized property list.
member.param: The property to remove the object from.
The attached object to remove.
member.remarks: This method removes the object's sync ID from the specified property list and triggers network synchronization on the server to inform clients of the change.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum
member.summary: Base interface for extended enums that can be dynamically registered and retrieved.
member.remarks: This interface provides the foundation for the GameCore enum extension system, allowing enums to be extended at runtime and providing efficient lookup mechanisms through hash-based mapping.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum.InnerValue
member.summary: Gets the underlying enum value wrapped by this extended enum.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum.EnumMap
member.summary: Gets the global map of all registered extended enum instances indexed by their hash codes.
member.remarks: This static dictionary maintains all extended enum instances for efficient lookup. Values are registered during enum initialization. TODO: Consider if storing IExtendedEnum is necessary, or if storing only the inner enum would suffice.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum.InnerEnumMapFrozen
member.summary: Gets the frozen dictionary used for optimized enum lookups.
member.remarks: This is created lazily from to provide fast, read-only access to enum instances during runtime operations.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum.FromHashCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves an extended enum instance by its hash code.
member.param: The hash code of the enum to retrieve.
member.returns: The extended enum instance if found; otherwise, null.
member.remarks: This method provides efficient lookup of extended enum instances using their hash codes, which are computed consistently across the extension system.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendedEnum.InnerEnumFromHashCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the inner enum value by its hash code.
member.param: The hash code of the enum to retrieve.
member.returns: The inner enum value if found; otherwise, null.
member.remarks: This method provides direct access to the underlying enum value without the extended enum wrapper, useful for performance-critical scenarios.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendableEnum
member.summary: Marker interface for extendable enums that inherit from .
member.remarks: This interface serves as a marker to identify enums that participate in the extension system without adding additional functionality.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendableEnum`1
member.summary: Generic interface for strongly-typed extendable enums.
member.typeparam: The concrete type implementing this interface.
member.remarks: This interface provides type-safe factory methods for creating instances of extendable enums from their underlying enum values, enabling the extension system to work with specific enum types while maintaining type safety.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendableEnum`1.MakeInstance(System.Enum)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the extendable enum from an enum value.
member.param: The enum value to wrap.
member.returns: A new instance of wrapping the enum value.
member.remarks: This method provides a generic way to create extendable enum instances and delegates to the type-specific method.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IExtendableEnum`1.Make(System.Enum)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the extendable enum from an enum value.
member.param: The enum value to wrap.
member.returns: A new instance of wrapping the enum value.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by concrete extendable enum types to provide type-specific instance creation logic.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IGameClass
member.summary: Register game classes that are used in the game setups.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IHostedObject
member.summary: Defines an interface for objects that are hosted by other entities and can manage cooldowns.
member.remarks: This interface represents objects that exist as components or attachments to host entities, inheriting cooldown management capabilities from . Hosted objects typically depend on their host for lifecycle management, positioning, and other contextual information while providing their own cooldown-based functionality.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IKillable
member.summary: Defines an interface for entities that can be killed and potentially revived.
member.remarks: This interface provides death state management and control for game entities. It supports different death types and contexts, allowing for varied death behaviors and revival mechanics. On the server side, it provides methods to kill and revive entities, while both server and client can check the death state.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IKillable.IsDead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this entity is currently dead.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IKillable.Kill(GameCore.BaseType.DeathType,GameCore.Interface.IExecutionContext)
member.summary: Kills this entity with the specified death type and execution context.
member.param: The type of death that occurred (e.g., normal, environmental, etc.).
The execution context that caused the death, if any.
member.remarks: This method triggers the death process for the entity, which may include playing death animations, dropping items, awarding experience, and other death-related game logic.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IKillable.Revive
member.summary: Revives this entity, bringing it back from the dead state.
member.remarks: This method restores the entity to a living state, typically resetting health and other vital properties. The specific revival behavior depends on the entity type and game rules.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IObjectManager`1
member.summary: Defines a generic interface for managing collections or groups of objects of a specific type.
member.typeparam: The type of objects to be managed by this manager.
member.remarks: This interface serves as a marker and base contract for object management systems within the game. Implementations are expected to provide specific management functionality for their object types, such as creation, destruction, tracking, and lifecycle management. The interface itself is empty to allow maximum flexibility for implementing classes to define their own management contracts.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IStateOwner`1
member.summary: Defines an interface for objects that can manage states and immunities of a specific type.
member.typeparam: The type of state that this owner can manage. Must be a non-null type.
member.remarks: This interface provides a system for managing both active states and immunities to states. States represent conditions or effects that are active on the object, while immunities prevent certain states from being applied.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IStateOwner`1.AddState(`0)
member.summary: Adds a state to this object.
member.param: The state to add.
member.remarks: If the object has immunity to this state, the state may not be added.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IStateOwner`1.RemoveState(`0)
member.summary: Removes a state from this object.
member.param: The state to remove.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IStateOwner`1.HasState(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether this object currently has the specified state.
member.param: The state to check for.
member.returns: true if the object has the state; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IStateOwner`1.AddImmunity(`0)
member.summary: Adds immunity to a specific state, preventing it from being applied to this object.
member.param: The state to become immune to.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IStateOwner`1.RemoveImmunity(`0)
member.summary: Removes immunity to a specific state, allowing it to be applied to this object again.
member.param: The state to remove immunity from.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IStateOwner`1.HasImmunity(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether this object is immune to the specified state.
member.param: The state to check immunity for.
member.returns: true if the object is immune to the state; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget
member.summary: Defines the interface for objects that can be targeted by abilities, movement, or other game systems.
member.remarks: ITarget provides a unified interface for all objects that can serve as targets in the game world, including entities, units, scene points, and other interactive objects. It standardizes position access, validity checking, range calculations, visibility determination, and other targeting-related operations. The interface supports both server-side and client-side targeting logic with appropriate abstractions for multiplayer scenarios. All targeting systems in the game rely on this interface for consistent behavior across different object types.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.Position
member.summary: Gets the position of this target in the game world.
member.value: The scene point representing the target's current position.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.Unit
member.summary: Gets the unit associated with this target, if applicable.
member.value: The unit representation of this target, or null if this target is not a unit.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.Entity
member.summary: Gets the entity associated with this target, if applicable.
member.value: The entity representation of this target, or null if this target is not an entity.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.Facing
member.summary: Gets the facing direction of this target, if applicable.
member.value: The direction this target is facing, or null if the target has no facing direction.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.Scene
member.summary: Gets the scene that contains this target.
member.value: The scene where this target is located.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this target is valid and can be used for targeting operations.
member.value: True if the target is valid; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.CanChangePosition
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this target's position can be changed.
member.value: True if the target can move or be moved; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Static targets like waypoints or fixed positions return false, while dynamic targets like units return true. This affects how movement and positioning systems interact with the target.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.IsChangingPosition
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this target is currently changing its position.
member.value: True if the target is in the process of moving; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is only available on the server side and is used to track movement states for synchronization and prediction purposes.

member.name: E:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.OnPositionChangingStart
member.summary: Occurs when this target starts changing its position.
member.remarks: This event is fired when the target begins a movement operation. It's useful for systems that need to track movement states or respond to position changes.

member.name: E:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.OnPositionChangingEnd
member.summary: Occurs when this target finishes changing its position.
member.remarks: This event is fired when the target completes a movement operation. It's useful for systems that need to track movement states or respond to position changes.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.ApproachableTarget
member.summary: Gets the approachable target interface for pathfinding and movement systems.
member.value: An interface that provides pathfinding information for reaching this target.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.IsValidTargetTo(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether this target is valid for targeting by the specified caster.
member.param: The entity attempting to target this object.
Whether this is a targeting request that requires visibility.
member.returns: True if this target can be targeted by the caster; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method checks basic targeting validity such as being in the same scene. Derived implementations may add additional checks for visibility, relationships, or other factors.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.IsInRange(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether this target is within the specified range of the caster.
member.param: The entity checking range to this target.
The maximum range to check.
Whether this is a targeting request that requires validity.
member.returns: True if the target is within range; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Range calculation includes the interaction radii of both the caster and target to account for object sizes. The method also verifies targeting validity before checking distance.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.SameScene(GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget)
member.summary: Determines whether this target is in the same scene as another target.
member.param: The target to compare scenes with.
member.returns: True if both targets are in the same scene; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Scene comparison is fundamental for many targeting operations, as cross-scene targeting is typically not supported. This method provides a standard way to check scene compatibility.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.CanBeSeen(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity)
member.summary: Determines whether this target can be seen by the specified caster.
member.param: The entity attempting to see this target.
member.returns: True if this target is visible to the caster; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Visibility rules vary by implementation and may consider factors such as line of sight, fog of war, stealth effects, and player relationships. This method must be implemented by concrete target types to provide appropriate visibility logic.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.InteractRadius
member.summary: Gets the interaction radius of this target for range and collision calculations.
member.value: The radius around this target used for interaction range calculations.
member.remarks: The interaction radius affects how close other objects need to be to interact with this target. Larger objects typically have larger interaction radii to account for their size.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.AngleTo(GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget)
member.summary: Calculates the angle from this target to another target.
member.param: The target to calculate the angle to.
member.returns: The angle to the target, or null if they are at the same position or in different scenes.
member.remarks: If the targets are at the same position, this method returns the current facing direction. Otherwise, it calculates the angle based on the relative positions of the two targets.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget.VectorTargetPosition(GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates a position at a specified distance in the direction of another target.
member.param: The target to calculate the vector towards.
The distance from this target's position.
member.returns: The calculated scene point, or null if the targets are in different scenes.
member.remarks: This method is useful for positioning effects, projectiles, or other objects at a specific distance in the direction of a target. The vector length is adjusted by this target's interaction radius to account for object size.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IThinker
member.summary: Defines an interface for objects that require regular update processing each game tick.
member.remarks: The thinking system allows objects to perform per-frame logic such as AI processing, animation updates, timers, or other time-based behaviors. Objects can enable or disable their thinking state dynamically to optimize performance by only processing active objects.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IThinker.Think(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the object's per-tick thinking logic.
member.param: The time elapsed since the last tick, in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This method is called every game tick when is true. Implementations should perform their frame-based logic here, such as AI decisions, state updates, or timer processing.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IThinker.DoesThink
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this object should be included in the thinking system.
member.remarks: When set to true, the object is registered with the game's thinking system and will be called each tick. When set to false, the object is unregistered and stops receiving think calls, improving performance for inactive objects.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.IThinkerStaggered.Think
member.summary: Only think when DoesThink = true;

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITickFinalizer
member.summary: Defines an interface for objects that need to perform cleanup or finalization operations at the end of each game tick.
member.remarks: This interface is used for objects that need to execute logic after all other tick processing has completed. Implementations should register themselves using to be included in the finalization process.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITickFinalizer.TickFinalizer
member.summary: Performs finalization operations at the end of a game tick.
member.remarks: This method is called after all other tick processing has completed for the current frame. It should be used for cleanup operations, state finalization, or any logic that needs to run after all other systems have updated.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseInterface.ITickFinalizer.PendingFinalizer
member.summary: Registers this object to be processed during the tick finalization phase.
member.remarks: Call this method to ensure that will be called at the end of the current or next tick. The object will be automatically managed by the game's tick finalization system.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseInterface.IUnitModificationData
member.summary: Defines data for modifying unit properties, states, and immunities.
member.remarks: This interface represents a collection of modifications that can be applied to units, including property changes, state additions/removals, and immunity grants. It's commonly used by abilities, items, and other game systems that need to modify unit characteristics temporarily or permanently.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IUnitModificationData.Modifications
member.summary: Gets a list of property modifications to apply to the unit.
member.remarks: These modifications can change unit attributes like damage, armor, speed, etc. Each modification specifies the property to change and how to change it.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IUnitModificationData.AddStates
member.summary: Gets a list of states to add to the unit.
member.remarks: States represent temporary or permanent conditions that affect unit behavior, such as buffs, debuffs, or special status effects.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IUnitModificationData.RemoveStates
member.summary: Gets a list of states to remove from the unit.
member.remarks: This can be used to clear specific states or conditions from the unit, such as removing debuffs or clearing temporary effects.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseInterface.IUnitModificationData.ImmuneStates
member.summary: Gets a list of states that the unit should become immune to.
member.remarks: Immune states prevent the unit from being affected by specific conditions, providing protection against certain types of effects or abilities.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseType.AbilityStage
member.summary: Defines the execution stages of an ability lifecycle.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.AbilityStage.Approach
member.summary: The approach stage where the caster moves into position or range to use the ability.
member.remarks: During this stage, the entity may move closer to the target or adjust positioning as required by the ability's range and targeting requirements.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.AbilityStage.Start
member.summary: The initial stage when the ability execution begins.
member.remarks: This stage marks the beginning of the ability's execution sequence, typically involving initial setup and preparation.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.AbilityStage.Cast
member.summary: The casting stage where the ability is being prepared or charged.
member.remarks: During this stage, the ability is actively being cast, which may involve cast time, mana consumption, and casting animations or effects.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.AbilityStage.Channel
member.summary: The channeling stage for abilities that require sustained casting.
member.remarks: Some abilities require continuous channeling to maintain their effect. During this stage, the caster must maintain focus and cannot perform other actions.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.AbilityStage.Finish
member.summary: The final stage when the ability execution is completed.
member.remarks: This stage represents the conclusion of the ability's execution, including any cleanup, final effects, or post-execution behaviors.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseType.ECmdResult
member.summary: Internal enum defining the base command result values.
member.remarks: This enum serves as the foundation for the command result system, with representing successful command execution. Additional error values are defined through the extendable enum system.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.ECmdResult.Ok
member.summary: Indicates that the command executed successfully without errors.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a command execution, indicating success or failure.
member.remarks: This struct provides a type-safe way to handle command results throughout the game systems. It uses the extendable enum system to support both success and various error conditions. The struct supports boolean operations and comparison operators for convenient result checking.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult.Error
member.summary: Gets the error information if the command failed, or null if successful.
member.remarks: This property provides access to detailed error information when the command result indicates failure. When the result is , this returns null.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult.IsSuccess
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the command executed successfully.
member.remarks: This property provides a convenient way to check if the command completed without errors. It returns true only when the inner value is .

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult.op_True(GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult)
member.summary: Enables the use of in boolean contexts, returning true for success.
member.param: The command result to evaluate.
member.returns: true if the command was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operator allows to be used directly in if statements and other boolean contexts.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult.op_False(GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult)
member.summary: Enables the use of in boolean contexts, returning false for success.
member.param: The command result to evaluate.
member.returns: false if the command was successful; otherwise, true.
member.remarks: This operator is the complement of the true operator and is required for boolean logic operations.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult.op_LogicalNot(GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult)
member.summary: Negates the success state of the command result.
member.param: The command result to negate.
member.returns: true if the command failed; false if it succeeded.
member.remarks: This operator allows for negation of the success state, useful for checking failure conditions.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult.op_BitwiseAnd(GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult,GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult)
member.summary: Performs a logical AND operation on two command results, returning the more severe error.
member.param: The first command result.
The second command result.
member.returns: The command result with the higher error severity.
member.remarks: This operator is used to combine multiple command results, with higher integer values representing more severe errors. If both results are successful, returns success.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult.op_BitwiseOr(GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult,GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult)
member.summary: Performs a logical OR operation on two command results, preferring success over failure.
member.param: The first command result.
The second command result.
member.returns: A successful result if either input is successful; otherwise, the less severe error.
member.remarks: This operator returns success if either operand is successful. If both are errors, it returns the error with lower severity (smaller integer value).

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult.Ok
member.summary: Indicates that the command executed successfully without errors.

member.typeparam: The type of value returned by the successful command execution.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult`1.Value
member.summary: Gets the value returned by the successful command execution, or null if the command failed.
member.remarks: This property is only non-null when is true. The compiler enforces this relationship through nullable reference type annotations.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult`1.Result

member.remarks: This property provides access to the base command result information, including error details when the command fails.

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult`1.Error

member.name: P:GameCore.BaseType.CmdResult`1.IsSuccess
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the command executed successfully and returned a value.
member.remarks: When this property is true, the property is guaranteed to be non-null. When false, the property will contain error information.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseType.DeathType
member.summary: Defines the different types of death or destruction that can occur to game entities.
member.remarks: This enum categorizes how entities die or are removed from the game, which can affect visual effects, sound effects, revival possibilities, and other game mechanics. Different death types may trigger different behaviors or restrictions.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.DeathType.Normal
member.summary: Standard death through normal game mechanics such as health reaching zero.
member.remarks: This represents typical death scenarios where an entity dies through conventional means like damage, poison, or other health-depleting effects. Normal deaths may allow for revival or resurrection depending on game rules.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.DeathType.Destroy
member.summary: Complete destruction that removes the entity entirely from the game.
member.remarks: This represents total annihilation where the entity is completely removed and typically cannot be revived. Used for permanent removal scenarios.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.DeathType.Impact
member.summary: Death caused by high-impact forces or collision-based damage.
member.remarks: This represents death from physical impacts, explosions, or collision damage. May trigger specific visual or audio effects related to impact scenarios.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.DeathType.Nullified
member.summary: Death caused by nullification, dispelling, or reality-warping effects.
member.remarks: This represents death from magical nullification, reality manipulation, or other supernatural causes that erase or negate the entity's existence. May bypass normal death protections or immunities.

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseType.DisposableObject.DisposeUnmanaged(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Override this method to dispose unmanaged resources.
member.param: If true, the method is called from the finalizer.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseType.Fraction
member.summary: Represents a fractional value in the range [0.0, 1.0].
member.remarks: The struct is designed to encapsulate a fractional value that is always constrained to the range [0.0, 1.0]. Any attempt to create a with a value outside this range will result in a debug assertion failure in debug builds.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseType.Probability
member.summary: Represents a probability value in the range [0.0, 1.0].
member.remarks: The struct is designed to encapsulate a probability value, ensuring it remains within the valid range of 0.0 to 1.0. It provides methods and operators for arithmetic operations, random generation, and conversions to and from other numeric types. This type is immutable. It is suitable for use in scenarios requiring high-precision probability calculations, such as simulations or statistical modeling. 精确到小数点后28位。

member.name: M:GameCore.BaseType.Probability.NextRandom
member.summary: Generates a new random probability value.
member.remarks: The generated probability is created using a high-precision random number generator. This method is suitable for scenarios requiring precise random values within the range of probabilities.
member.returns: A instance representing a random value between 0 and 1, inclusive.

member.name: T:GameCore.BaseType.TargetType
member.summary: Defines the types of targets that can be selected or referenced in game operations.
member.remarks: This enum is used throughout the targeting system to specify what kinds of objects can be targeted by abilities, commands, or other game actions. It helps validate target compatibility and filter appropriate targets for different operations.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.TargetType.Any
member.summary: Accepts any valid target type, including units and points.
member.remarks: This is the most permissive target type, allowing operations to work with any targetable object or location in the game world.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.TargetType.Unit
member.summary: Targets must be unit entities (living or interactive objects).
member.remarks: This restricts targeting to units only, such as players, NPCs, creatures, or other entity-based objects that can participate in game interactions.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.TargetType.Point
member.summary: Targets must be specific points or locations in the game world.
member.remarks: This restricts targeting to positional coordinates or locations, typically used for area-of-effect abilities or movement commands.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.EUnitState.SuppressMovement
member.summary: Temporarily prevents the unit from walking or pathfinding, such as when stunned or frozen by a buff. Unlike this state suggests that the unit's movement is temporarily suppressed; it still allows the unit to handle approach orders and resume movement. The unit will proceed to moving once the suppression is lifted.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.EUnitState.DisableMovement
member.summary: Permanently disables the unit's ability to move, preventing walking, pathfinding, or handling approach orders. Unlike this state indicates indefinite movement restriction; instead of temporarily suppressed, the unit will not be able to handle any approaching orders.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.EUnitState.SuppressTurning
member.summary: Temporarily prevents the unit from turning or facing to an object, such as when stunned or frozen by a buff.
member.remarks: Unlike this state suggests that the unit's turning is temporarily suppressed; it still allows the unit to handle approach orders and resume turning. The unit will proceed to turning once the suppression is lifted.

member.name: F:GameCore.BaseType.EUnitState.DisableTurning
member.summary: Disables the ability to turn or face to an object.
member.remarks: This method prevents any further turning or facing actions on the object. It is typically used to lock the object's orientation in scenarios where facing is not allowed.

member.name: T:GameCore.Behavior.GameDataModifier
member.summary: Represents the base class for behavior modifier configurations that alter or enhance entity behaviors and properties.
member.remarks: This class serves as the foundation for all behavior modification systems, including buffs, debuffs, passive abilities, auras, and other effects that dynamically alter how entities behave or perform. Modifiers can affect properties like damage, speed, health, abilities, and other gameplay characteristics, providing a flexible system for temporary or permanent changes to entity behavior.

member.name: P:GameCore.Behavior.Response.IsPersistDuringMorph

member.name: T:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraPositionMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode used to position the camera in a 3D scene.
member.remarks:
This enumeration defines the two primary modes for camera positioning:
FocalPoint
Positions the camera based on a focal point in the scene, typically used for targeting a specific object or area.
CameraLocation
Positions the camera based on the camera's location, often used for first-person or free-camera perspectives.
Use this enumeration to configure how the camera interacts with the scene, depending on the desired perspective or interaction model.

member.name: F:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraPositionMode.FocalPoint
member.summary: Positions the camera based on a focal point in the scene, typically used for targeting a specific object or area.

member.name: F:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraPositionMode.CameraLocation
member.summary: Positions the camera based on the camera's location, often used for first-person or free-camera perspectives.

member.name: T:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraTargetingMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode used to determine how the camera targets or interacts with entities or the scene.
member.remarks:
This enumeration defines the primary modes for camera targeting:
FollowTarget
The camera follows a target entity, maintaining a specified distance and angle. This is commonly used for third-person or chase camera perspectives.
StaticPosition
The camera remains in a fixed position and does not follow any target entity. This is useful for cutscenes or overview perspectives.
GestureDriven
The camera is controlled by user gestures, allowing for free interaction. This is often used in touch-based or VR environments.

member.name: F:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraTargetingMode.Follow
member.summary: The camera follows a target entity, maintaining a specified distance and angle from it.

member.name: F:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraTargetingMode.Static
member.summary: The camera is in a fixed position and does not follow any target entity.

member.name: F:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraTargetingMode.Gesture
member.summary: Represents a gesture-driven mode for the camera, allowing for user interaction through gestures.

member.name: T:GameCore.Components.Component
member.summary: Base class for all components that can be attached to entities, providing common lifecycle management and disposal functionality.
member.remarks: Components are modular pieces of functionality that can be attached to entities to provide specific behaviors or capabilities. This class handles the basic component lifecycle including creation, validation, and proper disposal. All components are automatically managed by their host entity.

member.name: M:GameCore.Components.Component.#ctor(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity)
member.summary: Initializes a new component and associates it with the specified host entity.
member.param: The entity that will own this component.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Component.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this component is still valid and has not been disposed.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Component.Host
member.summary: Gets the entity that owns this component.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Component.SyncId
member.summary: Gets the synchronization identifier for this component, used for networking and replication.

member.name: M:GameCore.Components.Component.Destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Destroys this component and removes it from its host entity.
member.param: Indicates whether this destruction is part of the host entity being disposed.

member.name: M:GameCore.Components.Component.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs the disposal of this component.
member.param: True if called from Dispose method; false if called from finalizer.

member.name: M:GameCore.Components.Component.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Disposes managed resources. Override this method to clean up managed resources specific to derived components.

member.name: M:GameCore.Components.Component.DisposeUnmanaged
member.summary: Disposes unmanaged resources. Override this method to clean up unmanaged resources specific to derived components.

member.name: M:GameCore.Components.Component.System#IDisposable#Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:GameCore.Components.Component`1
member.summary: Generic base class for typed components that automatically manage their registration in component sets.
member.typeparam: The specific component type, used for type-safe component set management.
member.remarks: This class extends the base Component to provide type-safe component set management. Components of the same type are automatically grouped together in sets on their host entity, enabling efficient querying and management of similar components.

member.name: M:GameCore.Components.Component`1.DisposeManaged

member.name: T:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget
member.summary: Defines the configuration interface for movement target data, extending basic mover functionality with target-specific properties.
member.remarks: This interface provides configuration for movers that move toward specific targets, including speed control, trajectory settings for parabolic movement, directional behavior, and ground alignment. It supports complex movement patterns like projectile arcs, homing behaviors, and physics-based motion with acceleration limits.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.Speed
member.summary: Gets the base movement speed function for the mover.
member.remarks: This defines the primary speed at which the mover approaches its target. The function allows for dynamic speed calculation based on execution context.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.Acceleration
member.summary: Gets the acceleration function that determines how quickly the mover reaches its target speed.
member.remarks: When specified, the mover will gradually accelerate to its target speed rather than instantly achieving it. This provides more realistic and smooth movement behavior.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.MinSpeed
member.summary: Gets the minimum speed function that constrains the lower bound of movement speed.
member.remarks: This ensures the mover maintains a minimum velocity even when slowing down or when other factors would reduce its speed below this threshold.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.MaxSpeed
member.summary: Gets the maximum speed function that constrains the upper bound of movement speed.
member.remarks: This caps the mover's velocity to prevent excessive speed, even when acceleration or other factors would increase speed beyond this limit.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.LaunchHeight
member.summary: Gets the launch height function for parabolic movement trajectories.
member.remarks: When specified, the mover will begin its trajectory at this height above its starting position, creating an arc-like movement pattern suitable for projectiles or jumping behaviors.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.TargetHeight
member.summary: Gets the target height function that defines the vertical position of the destination.
member.remarks: This determines the final height where the mover should arrive. Combined with launch height, it helps define the overall trajectory shape for parabolic movement.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.TargetHeightIsAbsolute
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the target height is an absolute world position or relative offset.
member.remarks: When true, represents an absolute world coordinate. When false, it represents an offset relative to the target's position.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.ParabolaApex
member.summary: Gets the parabola apex function that defines the highest point of the movement arc.
member.remarks: This controls the peak height of parabolic trajectories, allowing fine-tuning of arc shape for different visual and gameplay effects.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.ParabolaLandingHeight
member.summary: Gets the parabola landing height function that defines where the arc intersects the ground.
member.remarks: This determines the final ground level for parabolic movement, useful for projectiles that need to account for terrain height differences.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.TurnToDirection
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the mover should rotate to face its movement direction.
member.remarks: When true, the mover will automatically orient itself to face the direction it's moving, providing natural-looking movement behavior for units and projectiles.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.TurnToVelocity
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the mover should rotate to face its velocity vector.
member.remarks: Similar to but uses the actual velocity vector, which may differ from movement direction when acceleration or external forces are applied.

member.name: P:GameCore.Components.Data.IGameDataMoverTarget.StickToGround
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the mover should maintain contact with the ground during movement.
member.remarks: When true, the mover will follow terrain contours and stay grounded rather than moving in straight lines through the air. This is useful for ground-based units.

member.name: T:GameCore.Container.Inventory
member.summary: Represents an inventory container that manages a collection of item slots for storing and organizing items.
member.remarks: The Inventory class provides a structured way to store, organize, and manipulate items within a game system. It consists of a collection of slots, each capable of holding specific types of items based on configuration. The inventory supports item absorption (stacking), assignment, and various operations for item management. Each inventory is associated with a carrier unit and managed by an InventoryManager for lifecycle control. The system handles item state management, ownership changes, and synchronization for multiplayer scenarios.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.Inventory.Slots
member.summary: Gets the collection of inventory slots that make up this inventory.
member.value: A list of inventory slots configured for this inventory.
member.remarks: Each slot can hold one or more items (if stacking is supported) and has its own configuration for item type restrictions and requirements.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.Inventory.Manager
member.summary: Gets the inventory manager that owns this inventory.
member.value: The manager responsible for this inventory's lifecycle and operations.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.Inventory.Carrier
member.summary: Gets the unit that carries this inventory.
member.value: The unit that owns and carries this inventory.
member.remarks: The carrier unit determines the context for item requirements, ownership changes, and spatial operations like dropping items to the ground.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.Inventory.Absorb(GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemPickable)
member.summary: Attempts to absorb (stack) the specified item into existing items in this inventory.
member.param: The item to absorb into existing stacks.
member.returns: The total amount of the item that was absorbed.
member.remarks: This method tries to merge the incoming item with existing items of the same type in the inventory. It's particularly useful for stackable items like resources or consumables. The method will distribute the item across multiple stacks if necessary and possible.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.Inventory.Items
member.summary: Gets all items currently stored in this inventory.
member.value: An enumerable collection of all non-null items in the inventory slots.
member.remarks: This property provides a convenient way to iterate through all items without having to check individual slots. Empty slots are automatically excluded.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.Inventory.CanAssign(GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemPickable,GameCore.Container.ReasonItemAssign,GameCore.Container.InventorySlot)
member.summary: Checks if the specified item can be assigned to any slot in this inventory.
member.param: The item to test for assignment compatibility.
The reason for the assignment attempt.
The source slot for swap operations, if applicable.
member.returns: The first slot that can accept this item, or null if no suitable slot is found.
member.remarks: This method checks all slots in order to find the first one that can accept the item based on the slot's restrictions, item requirements, and the assignment reason. It's useful for previewing assignment operations before actually performing them.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.Inventory.Assign(GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemPickable,GameCore.Container.ReasonItemAssign,GameCore.Container.InventorySlot)
member.summary: Attempts to assign the specified item to the first available suitable slot in this inventory.
member.param: The item to assign to this inventory.
The reason for the assignment.
The source slot for swap operations, if applicable.
member.returns: The slot where the item was assigned, or null if the assignment failed.
member.remarks: This method first checks if the item can be assigned using CanAssign, then performs the actual assignment if a suitable slot is found. It provides a convenient way to add items to the inventory without manually managing slot selection.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.Inventory.Take(GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemPickable)
member.summary: Attempts to take the specified item into this inventory, using absorption and assignment as needed.
member.param: The item to take into this inventory.
member.returns: True if the item was successfully taken; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method first tries to absorb the item into existing stacks, then attempts to assign it to an empty slot if absorption doesn't fully consume the item. It provides the most convenient way to add items to an inventory with automatic handling of stacking behavior.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.Inventory.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this inventory including its type, name, ID, and slot/item counts.
member.returns: A formatted string describing this inventory.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.Inventory.DebuggerDisplay
member.summary: Gets the display string used by the debugger.
member.value: A string representation of this inventory for debugging purposes.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.Inventory.HandlePickUpRequest
member.summary: If true, the inventory will handle the pick up request. Otherwise, only none-request pick up orders will be handled.

member.name: T:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot
member.summary: Represents a single slot within an inventory that can hold an item with specific restrictions and requirements.
member.remarks: InventorySlot is the fundamental unit of item storage within an inventory system. Each slot can hold one item (or a stack of identical items) and enforces specific rules about what types of items can be assigned to it. Slots support item category filtering, requirement validation, and various assignment/drop operations. The slot handles item state management, ownership changes, and synchronization when items are assigned or removed. It integrates with the broader inventory system to provide flexible and controlled item management capabilities.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.#ctor(GameCore.Container.Inventory,GameCore.Container.Data.Struct.IInventorySlotData)
member.summary: Represents a single slot within an inventory that can hold an item with specific restrictions and requirements.
member.remarks: InventorySlot is the fundamental unit of item storage within an inventory system. Each slot can hold one item (or a stack of identical items) and enforces specific rules about what types of items can be assigned to it. Slots support item category filtering, requirement validation, and various assignment/drop operations. The slot handles item state management, ownership changes, and synchronization when items are assigned or removed. It integrates with the broader inventory system to provide flexible and controlled item management capabilities.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.Inventory
member.summary: Gets the inventory that contains this slot.
member.value: The parent inventory of this slot.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.Item
member.summary: Gets or sets the item currently stored in this slot.
member.value: The item in this slot, or null if the slot is empty.
member.remarks: This property is managed internally by the slot assignment system and should not be modified directly. Use the Assign and Drop methods to properly manage slot contents.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.Cache
member.summary: Gets the configuration data that defines the restrictions and behavior of this slot.
member.value: The slot configuration data containing rules and requirements.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.CanDrop(GameCore.Container.ReasonItemDrop,GameCore.Container.InventorySlot)
member.summary: Determines whether an item can be dropped from this slot for the specified reason.
member.param: The reason for dropping the item.
The source slot for swap operations, if applicable.
member.returns: True if the item can be dropped; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method checks inventory drop permissions and swap compatibility to determine if the drop operation is allowed. Different drop reasons have different requirements.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.Drop(GameCore.Container.ReasonItemDrop,GameCore.Container.InventorySlot)
member.summary: Drops the item from this slot according to the specified reason and parameters.
member.param: The reason for dropping the item.
The source slot for swap operations, if applicable.
member.returns: True if the drop was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method removes the item from the slot and handles the appropriate consequences based on the drop reason, such as placing the item on the ground or preparing it for swapping.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.Carrier
member.summary: Gets the unit that carries the inventory containing this slot.
member.value: The carrier unit of the parent inventory.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.CanAssign(GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemPickable,GameCore.Container.ReasonItemAssign,GameCore.Container.InventorySlot)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified item can be assigned to this slot.
member.param: The item to test for assignment compatibility.
The reason for the assignment attempt.
The source slot for swap operations, if applicable.
member.returns: True if the item can be assigned to this slot; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs comprehensive validation including item validity, slot availability, category restrictions, requirements checking, and swap compatibility. It's used to preview assignment operations before actually performing them.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.Assign(GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemPickable,GameCore.Container.ReasonItemAssign,GameCore.Container.InventorySlot)
member.summary: Assigns the specified item to this slot, handling swapping and state management as needed.
member.param: The item to assign to this slot.
The reason for the assignment.
The source slot for swap operations, if applicable.
member.returns: True if the assignment was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs the actual assignment operation after validation, handling item swapping, inventory state application, and proper cleanup of source slots. It coordinates with the broader inventory system to ensure consistent item management.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.Put(GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemPickable)
member.summary: Attempts to put an item in this slot, using absorption or assignment as appropriate.
member.param: The item to put in this slot.
member.returns: True if the item was successfully placed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method first attempts to absorb the item into an existing stack if possible, then falls back to assignment with swapping if absorption fails or is not applicable. It provides a convenient high-level interface for item placement.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.Destroy
member.summary: Destroys this inventory slot and releases its resources.
member.remarks: This method is used internally for slot lifecycle management and should not be called directly.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.MeetRequirement
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the item in this slot meets its requirements.
member.value: True if the slot contains an item that meets all requirements; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property reflects whether the currently stored item satisfies all requirements for proper functionality. Items that don't meet requirements may be disabled or restricted.

member.name: M:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this inventory slot including its configuration, index, and contained item.
member.returns: A formatted string describing this inventory slot.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.DebuggerDisplay
member.summary: Gets the display string used by the debugger.
member.value: A string representation of this inventory slot for debugging purposes.

member.name: P:GameCore.Container.InventorySlot.SlotIndex
member.summary: Gets the index of this slot within its parent inventory.
member.value: The zero-based index of this slot in the inventory's slot collection.
member.remarks: This property is calculated on first access and cached for efficiency. It's used for slot identification and ordering within the inventory system.

member.remarks: 此枚举提供了扩展能力，允许在运行时动态添加新的冷却时间宿主属性类型。 冷却时间宿主属性用于识别和访问可以承载冷却时间的不同容器和组件， 为冷却时间系统提供了灵活的存储和管理机制。

member.name: T:GameCore.Data.IGameDataMorph
member.summary: Defines the interface for morph transformation data, allowing entities to change into different unit types.
member.remarks: This interface provides configuration for morphing abilities that can transform one unit type into another. Morphing is commonly used for shape-shifting abilities, unit upgrades, or transformation effects. The transformation maintains certain properties while changing the unit's fundamental type and capabilities.

member.name: P:GameCore.Data.IGameDataMorph.MorphUnit

member.name: P:GameCore.Data.IGameDataMorph.MorphFlags
member.summary: Gets the flags that control how the morphing transformation behaves.
member.remarks: These flags determine various aspects of the morphing process, such as whether certain properties are preserved, how the transformation is visually presented, and what restrictions or conditions apply during the morph operation.
