member.name: T:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities
member.summary: DoubleUtil uses fixed eps to provide fuzzy comparison functionality for doubles. Note that FP noise is a big problem and using any of these compare methods is not a complete solution, but rather the way to reduce the probability of repeating unnecessary work.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.IsOne(System.Double)
member.summary: IsOne - Returns whether or not the double is "close" to 1. Same as AreClose(double, 1), but this is faster.
member.returns: bool - the result of the AreClose comparison.
member.param: The double to compare to 1.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.IsZero(System.Double)
member.summary: IsZero - Returns whether or not the double is "close" to 0. Same as AreClose(double, 0), but this is faster.
member.returns: bool - the result of the AreClose comparison.
member.param: The double to compare to 0.

member.name: F:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.Epsilon
member.summary: Epsilon - more or less random, more or less small number.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.AreClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: AreClose returns whether or not two doubles are "close". That is, whether or not they are within epsilon of each other. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.
member.returns: The result of the AreClose comparison.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.LessThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThan returns whether or not the first double is less than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.
member.returns: The result of the LessThan comparison.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.GreaterThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThan returns whether or not the first double is greater than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.
member.returns: The result of the GreaterThan comparison.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.LessThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThanOrClose returns whether or not the first double is less than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than or within epsilon of the other number. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.
member.returns: The result of the LessThanOrClose comparison.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.GreaterThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThanOrClose returns whether or not the first double is greater than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than or within epsilon of the other number. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.
member.returns: The result of the GreaterThanOrClose comparison.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.IsFinite(System.Double)
member.summary: Test to see if a double is a finite number (is not NaN or Infinity).
member.param: The value to test.
member.returns: Whether or not the value is a finite number.

member.name: M:GameCore.Standard.DoubleUtilities.IsValidSize(System.Double)
member.summary: Test to see if a double a valid size value (is finite and > 0).
member.param: The value to test.
member.returns: Whether or not the value is a valid size value.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.AcquireSettings
member.summary: Represents configuration settings for automatic ability acquisition and casting behavior.
member.remarks: AcquireSettings defines how abilities should behave when it comes to automatic casting, target acquisition, and recasting logic. This is commonly used for AI-controlled units or abilities that have automatic behavior patterns. The settings control when and how abilities are automatically triggered based on various conditions and filters. Note: This class is currently under development and some features may not be fully implemented.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.AcquireSettings.AutoCast
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ability can be automatically cast.
member.value: True if the ability supports automatic casting; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When enabled, this allows the ability to be cast automatically by AI systems or automatic behavior logic without direct player input. This is typically used for passive abilities or AI-controlled unit behaviors.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.AcquireSettings.AutoCastOn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether automatic casting is currently active.
member.value: True if automatic casting is currently enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This setting controls whether the automatic casting feature is currently active. It can be toggled independently of the AutoCast capability, allowing players or systems to temporarily disable automatic behavior while preserving the configuration.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.AcquireSettings.Recast
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ability should automatically recast when conditions are met.
member.value: True if the ability should recast automatically; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When enabled, the ability will automatically cast again after its previous casting completes, provided that valid targets and conditions are still available. This is useful for channeled abilities or abilities that should maintain continuous effect. Note: This feature is planned for implementation and may be used by client or AI systems.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.AcquireSettings.RecastUseAutoCast
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether recasting should use the same logic as automatic casting.
member.value: True if recasting should follow AutoCast rules; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the recasting behavior should follow the same targeting and condition logic as the initial automatic cast, or use different criteria. Note: This feature is not yet implemented.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.AcquireSettings.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether these acquire settings are enabled.
member.value: True if the acquire settings are active; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This serves as a master enable/disable switch for all automatic behavior defined in these settings. When disabled, none of the automatic casting or acquisition behaviors will function regardless of their individual settings.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.AcquireSettings.TargetingFilters
member.summary: Gets or sets the complex targeting filters used to determine valid targets for automatic casting.
member.value: A collection of targeting filters that define which entities can be targeted.
member.remarks: These filters are used by the automatic casting system to determine which entities are valid targets for the ability. The filters can include criteria such as enemy/ally status, unit types, health conditions, and other game-specific requirements.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.BuffFlags
member.summary: 定义 Buff 效果的行为标志，控制 Buff 的各种特性和生命周期管理
member.remarks: BuffFlags 类用于配置 Buff 效果的特殊行为，包括叠加规则、持续性设置、 死亡时的处理和引导效果等。这些标志影响 Buff 在游戏中的应用和管理方式。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.BuffFlags.SingleInstancePerCaster
member.summary: 获取或设置是否每个施法者只能对同一目标施加一个相同类型的 Buff 实例
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，如果同一个施法者尝试对已有相同 Buff 的目标再次施加该 Buff， 新的 Buff 会替换旧的实例，并重置 Buff 的持续时间。如果 Buff 未达到最大叠加次数，则会将新旧实例的叠加次数相加。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.BuffFlags.Permanent
member.summary: 获取或设置 Buff 是否为永久效果
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，Buff 不会因为变身、死亡等条件而消失。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.BuffFlags.DisableWhenDead
member.summary: 获取或设置当单位死亡时是否禁用此 Buff
member.remarks: 默认值为 true，意味着大多数 Buff 在单位死亡时会被禁用或移除。 设置为 false 可以让某些特殊效果在死亡后继续存在，例如灵魂形态或复活效果。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.BuffFlags.Channeling
member.summary: 获取或设置 Buff 是否为引导效果
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，表示此 Buff 需要施法者持续引导，如果施法者的引导被打断， 该 Buff 也会被移除。这通常用于需要集中精神维持的法术效果。

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.CooldownLocation
member.summary: 定义冷却时间的存储位置，决定冷却时间在哪个层级进行管理和共享
member.remarks: 冷却位置决定了冷却时间的作用域和共享规则。不同的位置允许冷却时间在不同的层级上进行管理， 从而实现各种复杂的冷却机制，如全局冷却、角色冷却、技能冷却等。

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.CooldownLocation.Self
member.summary: 自身冷却 - 仅影响当前对象
member.remarks: 冷却时间仅对当前的技能、物品或能力实例有效，不会影响其他实例。

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.CooldownLocation.Item
member.summary: 物品冷却 - 技能的默认值，当没有物品时会回退到技能冷却
member.remarks: 冷却时间与特定物品关联。这是技能的默认冷却位置， 因为没有物品时会回退到技能冷却机制。

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.CooldownLocation.Ability
member.summary: 技能冷却 - 冷却时间与特定技能关联
member.remarks: 同一技能上相同冷却数据链接的冷却实例共享同一个冷却时间。

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.CooldownLocation.Unit
member.summary: 单位冷却 - 冷却时间与特定单位关联
member.remarks: 冷却时间在单位级别进行管理，同一单位上相同冷却数据链接的冷却实例共享同一个冷却时间。

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.CooldownLocation.Player
member.summary: 玩家冷却 - 冷却时间与特定玩家关联
member.remarks: 冷却时间在玩家级别进行管理，同一玩家上相同冷却数据链接的冷却实例共享同一个冷却时间。

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.CooldownLocation.Game
member.summary: 游戏冷却 - 全局冷却时间
member.remarks: 冷却时间在整个游戏范围内生效，整个游戏中相同冷却数据链接的冷却实例共享同一个冷却时间。

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.Cost
member.summary: Represents the cost requirements for performing an action, including cooldowns, charges, vitals, and player resources.
member.remarks: The Cost class provides a comprehensive system for defining and managing resource requirements for game actions such as casting spells, using abilities, or performing other operations. It supports multiple types of costs including cooldown timers, charge systems, vital properties (like health and mana), and player-specific resources. The class includes validation methods to check if costs can be afforded and execution methods to actually spend the resources when an action is performed.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.Cost.Cooldown
member.summary: Gets or sets the active cooldown requirement for this cost.
member.value: A game data link to a cooldown configuration, or null if no cooldown is required.
member.remarks: Active cooldowns prevent actions from being performed until a specified time has elapsed. This is commonly used for abilities that have a recharge time between uses.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.Cost.Charge
member.summary: Gets or sets the charge system requirement for this cost.
member.value: A game data link to a charge configuration, or null if no charges are required.
member.remarks: Charge systems allow actions to be performed a limited number of times before requiring a recharge period. This is useful for abilities with multiple uses but limited availability.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.Cost.Vital
member.summary: Gets or sets the vital property costs (such as health, mana, or energy) required for this action.
member.value: A dictionary mapping vital properties to their cost functions.
member.remarks: Vital costs are typically used for abilities that consume health, mana, or other character resources. The cost functions allow for dynamic calculation based on the execution context, such as scaling with level or other modifiers.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.Cost.PlayerCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the player-specific numeric costs required for this action.
member.value: A dictionary mapping player numeric properties to their cost functions.
member.remarks: Player costs represent resources that belong to the player rather than individual units, such as gold, experience, or other shared resources. This feature is currently under development.

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.Cost.CooldownCheck(GameCore.CostSystem.ICostSpender)
member.summary: Performs a cooldown and charge check for the specified cost spender.
member.param: The object requesting to spend costs, which manages cooldowns and charges.
member.returns: A command result indicating whether the cooldown and charge requirements are satisfied.
member.remarks: This method validates that the requester can proceed based on cooldown timers and available charges. It does not check other cost types like vital or player resources.

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.Cost.CanAfford(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,GameCore.Interface.IExecutionContext,GameCore.CostSystem.ICostSpender,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified caster can afford this cost.
member.param: The entity attempting to pay the cost.
The execution context providing additional parameters for cost calculation.
The object requesting to spend costs.
If true, only tests affordability without caching results for spending; if false, caches results for efficient spending.
If true and is true, skips cooldown validation for performance.
member.returns: A command result indicating whether the cost can be afforded.
member.remarks: This method performs comprehensive validation of all cost requirements including cooldowns, charges, vital properties, and player resources. When is false, it caches the calculated costs for efficient spending later. The method validates that the caster has sufficient resources and that adding negative costs (healing effects) wouldn't exceed maximum values.

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.Cost.Spend(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,GameCore.Interface.IExecutionContext,GameCore.CostSystem.ICostSpender)
member.summary: Spends the costs associated with this action on the specified caster.
member.param: The entity that will pay the costs.
The execution context used for cost calculations.
The object requesting to spend costs.
member.returns: true if all costs were successfully spent; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method is only available on the server side and actually deducts the required resources from the caster and their player. If costs haven't been cached by a previous call to CanAfford with testOnly=false, it will perform affordability checking first. The method handles cooldowns, charges, vital properties, and player resources atomically - if any part fails, no costs are spent. Negative costs (healing effects) will add resources instead of subtracting them.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleExpression
member.summary: 表示效果角度表达式，用于计算和确定效果的方向角度
member.remarks: EffectAngleExpression 类提供了灵活的角度计算机制，支持多种角度确定方法， 包括使用实体朝向、两点间角度计算和显式角度设置。这对于需要方向性的效果 （如投射物、区域效果、视觉特效等）提供了完整的角度计算解决方案。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleExpression.Method
member.summary: 获取或设置角度计算的方法
member.remarks: 默认使用朝向方法（Facing），即使用目标实体的朝向作为角度。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleExpression.Location
member.summary: 获取或设置主要目标位置表达式
member.remarks: 根据角度计算方法的不同，此位置可能作为起始点、朝向来源或角度计算的基础。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleExpression.OtherLocation
member.summary: 获取或设置其他目标位置表达式
member.remarks: 在两点间角度计算方法中，此位置作为终点，与主要位置配合计算方向角度。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleExpression.LocalOffset
member.summary: 获取或设置本地偏移角度函数
member.remarks: 此函数提供额外的角度偏移，会添加到计算出的基础角度上。 默认返回 0，表示无偏移。可用于微调或动态调整效果方向。

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleExpression.Parse(GameCore.Execution.Effect)
member.summary: 解析并计算效果的最终角度
member.param: 效果实例，提供计算所需的上下文信息
member.returns: 计算出的角度值，如果计算失败则返回 null
member.remarks:
根据配置的角度方法执行相应的计算逻辑：
：直接返回本地偏移角度
：计算两个位置间的角度并加上偏移
：使用目标的朝向角度并加上偏移
如果所需的目标位置无法解析，方法会返回 null。

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleMethod
member.summary: Defines the methods used to determine the angle for effect calculations.
member.remarks: This enum specifies how the angle should be calculated when applying effects that require directional information, such as projectiles, area effects, or visual effects that need orientation.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleMethod.Facing
member.summary: Uses the facing direction of the source entity.
member.remarks: The angle is determined by the current facing direction of the entity that is applying the effect.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleMethod.AngleBetweenTwoPoints
member.summary: Calculates the angle based on the direction between two points.
member.remarks: The angle is computed using the vector from a source point to a target point, typically used for targeted effects or projectiles.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.EffectAngleMethod.ExplicitAngle
member.summary: Uses a specific angle value that is explicitly provided.
member.remarks: The angle is set directly through configuration or parameters, allowing for precise control over the effect's direction.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.EffectLaunchMissileMethod
member.summary: Defines the methods for launching missiles in effect systems.
member.remarks: This enum specifies how missiles should be created and launched when applying missile-based effects. It determines whether to create new missile instances or reuse existing ones for performance optimization.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.EffectLaunchMissileMethod.CreateMissile
member.summary: Creates a new missile instance for the effect.
member.remarks: A new missile entity is instantiated and configured specifically for this effect. This provides full control over the missile's properties but has higher overhead.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.EffectLaunchMissileMethod.UseExistingMissile
member.summary: Uses an existing missile instance for the effect.
member.remarks: Reuses a pre-existing missile entity, which can improve performance by avoiding instantiation costs. The existing missile's properties may be modified as needed.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.EffectOffsetExpression
member.summary: 表示效果偏移表达式，用于计算基于角度和距离的位置偏移
member.remarks: EffectOffsetExpression 类提供了基于极坐标系统的位置偏移计算功能。 它使用角度表达式和距离函数来计算从原点开始的偏移位置， 常用于技能效果、投射物发射位置、AOE效果中心等需要精确位置控制的场景。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectOffsetExpression.Angle
member.summary: 获取或设置角度表达式，用于确定偏移的方向
member.remarks: 此角度表达式定义了从原点向外偏移的方向。 角度可以基于实体朝向、两点间夹角或显式角度值来计算。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectOffsetExpression.Distance
member.summary: 获取或设置距离函数，用于确定偏移的距离
member.remarks: 此函数计算从原点沿指定角度方向偏移的距离。 默认返回 0，表示无偏移。可以基于效果的各种参数动态计算距离。

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.EffectOffsetExpression.Parse(GameCore.Execution.Effect,GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget)
member.summary: 解析并计算最终的偏移位置
member.param: 效果实例，提供计算所需的上下文信息
原点位置，作为偏移计算的基础
member.returns: 计算出的最终位置点
member.remarks: 方法首先计算偏移距离，如果距离为 0 则直接返回原点位置。 否则使用角度表达式计算偏移方向，然后基于极坐标系统计算最终位置。 如果角度无法确定，则返回原点位置。 计算公式：最终位置 = 原点 + (角度方向 × 距离)

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.EffectOwner
member.summary: Defines who owns or controls an effect in the game.
member.remarks: This enum determines the ownership context for effects, which can influence their behavior, interactions, and lifecycle management within the game systems.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.EffectOwner.TargetLocation
member.summary: The effect is owned by or associated with the target location where it was created.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.EffectOwner.Neutral
member.summary: The effect has no specific owner and is considered neutral.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.EffectPropertyModification`1
member.summary: Represents a property modification configuration for effects that alter entity properties.
member.typeparam: The type of property being modified, which must implement .
member.remarks: This class defines how an effect should modify a specific property of an entity, including the property to modify, the calculation method for the new value, and optional randomization parameters.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectPropertyModification`1.Property
member.summary: Gets or sets the property to be modified by this effect.
member.remarks: This property specifies which entity property will be affected by the modification. The property type must be part of the extendable enum system for type safety.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectPropertyModification`1.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to calculate the modification value.
member.remarks: This function determines how the property value should be calculated or modified. The default implementation returns a constant value of 100. The function receives effect context parameters and returns the computed value.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.EffectPropertyModification`1.Random
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional random variation applied to the modification value.
member.remarks: When specified, this value introduces randomness to the property modification, allowing for variable effects rather than deterministic ones. If null, no randomization is applied.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.HashSetFilter`1
member.summary: Represents a generic filter for determining whether collections of items meet specific criteria based on required and excluded elements.
member.typeparam: The type of elements to filter.
member.remarks: HashSetFilter provides a flexible way to define filtering conditions for any type of collection. It uses inclusion (required) and exclusion criteria to determine if a collection is valid. A collection passes the filter if it contains all required elements and none of the excluded elements. This is a generic version of TargetFilter that can work with any type, not just unit filter tags.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.HashSetFilter`1.Required
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of elements that must be present for the filter to pass.
member.value: A set of elements that are required for the collection to be valid.
member.remarks: All elements in this collection must be present in the tested collection for the filter to pass. If this collection is empty, no specific elements are required (only exclusions apply).

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.HashSetFilter`1.Excluded
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of elements that disqualify a collection from passing the filter.
member.value: A set of elements that, if present, will cause the filter to fail.
member.remarks: If any element in this collection is present in the tested collection, the filter will fail regardless of which required elements are met. This provides a way to exclude specific elements.

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.HashSetFilter`1.Pass(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{`0})
member.summary: Determines whether the specified set of elements passes this filter.
member.param: The collection of elements to test against this filter.
member.returns: True if the elements pass the filter criteria; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
The filter passes if:
The collection has none of the excluded elements (no overlap with Excluded)
The collection has all of the required elements (Required is a subset of tags)
Both conditions must be met for the filter to pass.

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.HashSetFilter`1.Pass(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Determines whether the specified enumerable collection of elements passes this filter.
member.param: The enumerable collection of elements to test against this filter.
member.returns: True if the elements pass the filter criteria; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This overload accepts any enumerable collection, not just HashSet. The same filtering logic applies: the collection must contain all required elements and none of the excluded elements. For better performance with large collections, consider using the HashSet overload.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.InventoryFlags
member.summary: 定义物品栏系统的行为标志，控制物品的拾取、丢弃和使用权限
member.remarks: InventoryFlags 类用于配置物品栏系统中物品和容器的各种行为权限。 这些标志决定了玩家或系统是否可以对物品栏中的物品执行特定操作， 为不同类型的容器和物品提供了灵活的权限控制机制。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.InventoryFlags.HandlePickUpRequest
member.summary: 获取或设置是否处理物品拾取请求
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，物品栏系统会处理来自玩家的物品拾取请求。 当设置为 false 时，拾取请求会被忽略，物品无法被添加到此物品栏中。 默认值为 true。 即使设置为 false，物品也可以通过其他方式添加到物品栏中，如通过代码添加。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.InventoryFlags.AllowDrop
member.summary: 获取或设置是否允许丢弃物品
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，玩家可以从物品栏中丢弃物品到游戏世界中。 当设置为 false 时，丢弃操作被禁止，物品只能通过其他方式移除。 默认值为 true。这通常用于限制特殊容器或任务物品的丢弃。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.InventoryFlags.AllowUse
member.summary: 获取或设置是否允许使用物品
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，玩家可以直接使用物品栏中的物品（如消耗品、工具等）。 当设置为 false 时，使用操作被禁止，物品可能需要先移动到其他位置才能使用。 默认值为 true。这用于控制特定容器中物品的可用性。

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.EItemCategory
member.summary: 定义物品的分类类型，用于组织和管理游戏中的各种物品
member.remarks: 此枚举提供了扩展能力，允许在运行时动态添加新的物品分类。 物品分类用于物品栏管理、UI 显示、过滤器和其他需要按类型组织物品的系统中。 可以通过枚举扩展系统添加自定义的物品分类，如武器、防具、消耗品等。

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.LeveledData`1
member.summary: Represents a collection of data that varies by level, providing level-based data retrieval with automatic clamping.
member.typeparam: The type of data stored at each level.
member.remarks: LeveledData is commonly used for game mechanics where values change as a character or ability levels up, such as spell damage, ability cooldowns, or unit statistics. The class automatically handles level bounds by clamping the requested level to the available data range.

example.code:
var damage = new LeveledData<int> { 10, 20, 30, 40, 50 };
int level1Damage = damage.GetLeveledData(0); // Returns 10 (level 1) int level3Damage = damage.GetLeveledData(2); // Returns 30 (level 3) int maxDamage = damage.GetLeveledData(999); // Returns 50 (clamped to max level)

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.LeveledData`1.GetLeveledData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the data for the specified level, automatically clamping the level to valid bounds.
member.param: The zero-based level index to retrieve data for.
member.returns: The data for the specified level, or the closest valid level if the input is out of bounds.
member.exception: Thrown when the LeveledData collection is empty.
member.remarks:
This method provides safe access to leveled data by automatically clamping the level parameter:
Negative levels are clamped to 0 (minimum level)
Levels exceeding the data count are clamped to the maximum available level
This ensures that valid data is always returned as long as the collection is not empty.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.MorphFlags
member.summary: 定义变身系统的行为标志，控制变身时哪些属性和特征会发生改变
member.remarks: MorphFlags 类用于配置单位变身时的各种变化选项。变身是游戏中常见的机制， 可以用于技能效果、形态转换、临时强化等场景。这些标志提供了细粒度的控制， 允许开发者精确定义变身过程中哪些方面会被修改。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.MorphFlags.ChangeModel
member.summary: 获取或设置是否改变模型外观
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，变身会改变单位的 3D 模型、材质和视觉外观。 这是最常见的变身效果，让单位看起来完全不同。 默认值为 true。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.MorphFlags.ChangeAbilities
member.summary: 获取或设置是否改变技能能力
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，变身会改变单位可用的技能和能力。 这允许变身形态拥有完全不同的技能组合。 默认值为 false。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.MorphFlags.ChangeResponses
member.summary: 获取或设置是否改变响应行为
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，变身会改变单位对各种事件和刺激的响应方式。 这包括 AI 行为、交互方式、触发条件等。 默认值为 false。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.MorphFlags.ChangeUnitProperties
member.summary: 获取或设置是否改变单位属性
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，变身会改变单位的基础属性，如生命值、攻击力、移动速度等。 这允许变身形态具有不同的战斗能力和特征。 默认值为 false。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.MorphFlags.ChangeUnitStates
member.summary: 获取或设置是否改变单位状态
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，变身会改变单位的各种状态标记和分类。 这可能影响单位如何被其他系统识别和处理。 默认值为 false。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.MorphFlags.ChangeHeight
member.summary: 获取或设置是否改变单位高度
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，变身会改变单位的物理高度。 这影响碰撞检测、视线计算和其他基于高度的游戏机制。 默认值为 false。 TODO: 高度系统待实现

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.MorphFlags.ChangeLoot
member.summary: 获取或设置是否改变掉落物品
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，变身会改变单位死亡时掉落的物品。 这允许不同形态的单位掉落不同的战利品。 默认值为 false。 TODO: 掉落系统待实现

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.PlayerData
member.summary: Represents configuration data for a player in the game, including their identity, controller type, and team status.
member.remarks: This class is used to define player properties during game setup and initialization. It contains information about how the player is controlled and their relationship to other players.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.PlayerData.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier for this player.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.PlayerData.Controller
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of controller that manages this player (e.g., human, AI).

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.PlayerData.IsNeutral
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this player is neutral (not aligned with any team).

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.PropertyModificationOperation
member.summary: Defines the types of operations that can be performed when modifying properties.
member.remarks: This enum is used to specify how a property value should be changed during modification operations.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.PropertyModificationOperation.Set
member.summary: Sets the property to a specific value, replacing the current value.

member.name: F:GameCore.Struct.PropertyModificationOperation.Add
member.summary: Adds a value to the current property value.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.ResponseDamageFlags
member.summary: 定义伤害响应系统的行为标志，控制特定伤害事件的处理方式
member.remarks: ResponseDamageFlags 类用于配置伤害响应系统如何处理不同类型的伤害事件。 这些标志决定了响应器是否会对特定的伤害情况（如致命伤害、暴击、零伤害等）做出反应， 为创建复杂的伤害响应机制提供了灵活的控制选项。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.ResponseDamageFlags.Fatal
member.summary: 获取或设置是否响应致命伤害
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，响应器会对导致单位死亡的伤害事件做出反应。 这通常用于死亡时触发的特殊效果，如死亡爆炸、复活机制或遗言技能。 默认值为 false。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.ResponseDamageFlags.SetAsCrit
member.summary: 获取或设置是否将伤害设置为暴击
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，响应器可以强制将触发的伤害标记为暴击。 这允许某些技能或效果确保产生暴击伤害，无视正常的暴击计算。 默认值为 false。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.ResponseDamageFlags.HandleZeroDamage
member.summary: 获取或设置是否处理零伤害事件
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，响应器会对造成 0 点伤害的攻击做出反应。 这包括被完全抵挡、免疫或其他原因导致的无效伤害。 用于在即使没有造成实际伤害时也需要触发某些效果的场景。 默认值为 false。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.ResponseDamageFlags.HandleNullifiedDamage
member.summary: 获取或设置是否处理被无效化的伤害
member.remarks: 当设置为 true 时，响应器会对被护盾、无敌或其他保护机制完全抵消的伤害做出反应。 这与零伤害不同，无效化伤害是指原本会造成伤害但被特殊机制阻止的情况。 用于在伤害被阻挡时仍需要触发响应的场景。 默认值为 false。

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.SpellCastTime
member.summary: Represents the timing configuration for spell or ability casting phases.
member.remarks: SpellCastTime defines the various time durations involved in casting a spell or using an ability. It breaks down the casting process into distinct phases: preswing (preparation), cast (actual casting), channel (sustained effect), and backswing (recovery). Each phase can have different timing requirements and may be affected by various modifiers such as cast speed, interruption, or other game mechanics. This granular timing control allows for sophisticated spell mechanics and balanced gameplay.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.SpellCastTime.Preswing
member.summary: Gets or sets the preswing time function for the spell casting.
member.value: A function that calculates the preswing duration based on execution context.
member.remarks: Preswing represents the preparation phase before the actual spell casting begins. During this time, the caster may play preparation animations, gather energy, or perform other preliminary actions. The preswing phase can typically be interrupted without triggering cooldowns or consuming resources.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.SpellCastTime.Cast
member.summary: Gets or sets the cast time function for the main spell casting phase.
member.value: A function that calculates the casting duration based on execution context.
member.remarks: The cast time represents the core casting phase where the spell effect is being prepared and channeled. During this phase, the caster is typically vulnerable to interruption, and interrupting the cast may trigger partial cooldowns or resource consumption. This is often the longest phase of spell casting.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.SpellCastTime.Channel
member.summary: Gets or sets the channel time function for sustained spell effects.
member.value: A function that calculates the channeling duration based on execution context.
member.remarks: Channel time represents the duration for which a spell effect is actively maintained after the initial cast completes. During channeling, the caster typically cannot perform other actions and must maintain focus to continue the effect. Channeled spells can often be canceled early or interrupted by external effects. Spell costs will typically be consumed at the start of the channel phase.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.SpellCastTime.Backswing
member.summary: Gets or sets the backswing time function for the spell recovery phase.
member.value: A function that calculates the recovery duration based on execution context.
member.remarks: Backswing represents the recovery time after a spell has been cast. Backswing is typically can be interrupted by subsequent actions.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.SpellCastTime.NormalizedDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the normalized duration for the core casting phases (Preswing + Cast + Channel). When set, enforces that the combined time of these three phases equals exactly this value, while preserving their relative proportions.
member.value: A function that calculates the normalized duration based on execution context.

remarks.para:
Primary Use Case: This property is primarily designed for basic attack abilities where precise attack interval control is required. For such abilities, designers typically:
Set NormalizedDuration to the desired attack interval
Do not configure cooldown (cooldown = 0)
Configure backswing as interruptible

Scaling Behavior: When NormalizedDuration is set, all casting phases are scaled by the same factor to maintain animation coherence:
Preswing, Cast, Channel: Scaled to fit exactly within NormalizedDuration
Backswing: Scaled by the same factor but not included in NormalizedDuration

Attack Interval Control: For abilities with interruptible backswing, the effective attack interval equals NormalizedDuration because subsequent attacks will interrupt the backswing phase. This provides precise attack rhythm control.

Example: Setting NormalizedDuration = 2s for a basic attack with original timings Preswing=0.3s, Cast=1.2s, Channel=0.5s, Backswing=0.6s:
Scale factor = 2s / (0.3s + 1.2s + 0.5s) = 1.0
Adjusted: Preswing=0.3s, Cast=1.2s, Channel=0.5s, Backswing=0.6s
Complete casting time = 2.6s (for animation/UI purposes)
Effective attack interval = 2s (due to backswing interruption)

Edge Cases: If the sum of original core phase durations is zero or very small, the phases will be distributed equally within the normalized duration. Backswing scaling follows the same factor to maintain visual consistency.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.TargetFilter
member.summary: Represents a filter for determining whether targets meet specific criteria based on unit filter tags.
member.remarks: The TargetFilter class provides a flexible way to define targeting conditions for abilities, spells, and other game systems. It uses inclusion (required) and exclusion criteria to determine if a target is valid. A target passes the filter if it has all required tags and none of the excluded tags.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.TargetFilter.Required
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of tags that a target must have to pass the filter.
member.value: A set of unit filter tags that are required for the target to be valid.
member.remarks: All tags in this collection must be present on the target for the filter to pass. If this collection is empty, no specific tags are required (only exclusions apply).

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.TargetFilter.Excluded
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of tags that disqualify a target from passing the filter.
member.value: A set of unit filter tags that, if present, will cause the filter to fail.
member.remarks: If any tag in this collection is present on the target, the filter will fail regardless of which required tags are met. This provides a way to exclude specific types of targets.

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.TargetFilter.Pass(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{GameCore.BaseType.UnitFilterTag})
member.summary: Determines whether the specified set of tags passes this filter.
member.param: The collection of tags to test against this filter.
member.returns: True if the tags pass the filter criteria; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
The filter passes if:
The target has none of the excluded tags (no overlap with Excluded)
The target has all of the required tags (Required is a subset of tags)
Both conditions must be met for the filter to pass.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.TargetFilterComplex
member.summary: Represents a complex target filter that combines multiple individual target filters using OR logic.
member.remarks: TargetFilterComplex extends the List<TargetFilter> to provide a collection of filters where a target passes if it satisfies ANY of the individual filters in the collection. This allows for flexible targeting conditions where multiple different criteria can make a target valid. For example, you could target either "living enemies" OR "undead allies" by combining two separate filters. If the collection is empty, all targets pass by default.

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.TargetFilterComplex.Pass(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{GameCore.BaseType.UnitFilterTag})
member.summary: Determines whether the specified set of tags passes this complex filter.
member.param: The collection of unit filter tags to test against this filter.
member.returns: True if the tags pass any of the individual filters, or if no filters are defined; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method uses OR logic - the target passes if it satisfies ANY of the individual filters in the collection. If the collection is empty (no filters defined), the method returns true, effectively allowing all targets to pass. This provides a safe default for unfiltered targeting.

member.name: M:GameCore.Struct.TargetFilterComplex.Pass(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified target entity passes this complex filter from the perspective of the caster.
member.param: The entity that is performing the targeting (used to determine relationships).
The entity being evaluated as a potential target.
member.returns: True if the target passes any of the individual filters, or if no filters are defined; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method automatically extracts the target's filter tags relative to the caster and then evaluates them against all filters in the collection. It uses OR logic like the other Pass method, but provides a more convenient interface when working with entities directly. The method caches the extracted tags for efficiency during the evaluation process.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.UnitPropertyFormula
member.summary: Represents a formula for calculating unit property values based on dependencies and custom calculation logic.
member.remarks: UnitPropertyFormula provides a way to define complex property calculations that depend on other unit properties. This is commonly used for derived statistics where one property's value is calculated based on multiple other properties, such as calculating total damage from base damage plus bonuses, or determining movement speed based on agility and equipment modifiers. The formula system ensures that dependent properties are recalculated when their dependencies change.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.UnitPropertyFormula.DependedProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of unit properties that this formula depends on.
member.value: A set of property links that this formula uses as input for its calculations.
member.remarks: When any of the properties in this collection change, the formula will be recalculated automatically. This dependency tracking ensures that derived properties stay up-to-date when their inputs change. The property system uses this information to determine the order of calculations and avoid circular dependencies.

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.UnitPropertyFormula.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets the calculation function that computes the property value based on the unit's property complex.
member.value: A function that takes a UnitPropertyComplex and returns the calculated property value, or null if no formula is defined.
member.remarks: This function is called whenever the property value needs to be recalculated. It receives a UnitPropertyComplex object that provides access to all of the unit's current property values. The function should use the GetFinal method to retrieve the final calculated values of dependent properties, ensuring that all modifiers and other formulas have been applied.

member.name: T:GameCore.Struct.WeightedLink`1
member.summary: 表示带权重的游戏数据链接，用于随机选择和概率计算
member.typeparam: 游戏数据链接的类型
member.remarks: WeightedLink 类将游戏数据链接与权重值关联，用于实现基于权重的随机选择算法。 这通常用于掉落系统、随机事件、AI 决策等需要概率性选择的场景。 权重越高，被选中的概率越大。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.WeightedLink`1.Link
member.summary: 获取或设置游戏数据链接
member.remarks: 指向具体游戏数据的链接，可以为 null。 在随机选择过程中，只有非 null 的链接才会被考虑。

member.name: P:GameCore.Struct.WeightedLink`1.Weight
member.summary: 获取或设置链接的权重值
member.remarks: 权重决定了此链接在随机选择中被选中的相对概率。 默认权重为 1。权重为 0 的链接不会被选中，负权重通常被视为无效。 在多个加权链接的集合中，单个链接的选中概率 = 该链接权重 / 所有链接权重之和。

member.name: T:GameCore.TargetingSystem.RangeScaledVector
member.summary: Represents a 2D vector command target, which can be used in targeting. The actual targeting position is scaled based on the casting range. The X and Y components of the vector are scaling factors. For example, if the X component is 2 and the Y component is 3, the actual target position will be (2 * range, 3 * range).

member.summary: Represents a 2D vector command target, which can be used in targeting. The actual targeting position is scaled based on the casting range. The X and Y components of the vector are scaling factors. For example, if the X component is 2 and the Y component is 3, the actual target position will be (2 * range, 3 * range).

member.summary: Scales the vector by the given range.
member.param: The range to scale the vector by.
member.returns: A scaled .

member.name: M:GameCore.TargetingSystem.RangeScaledVector.TargetPosition(GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the target position based on the source position, interact radius and the range.

member.name: T:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for asynchronous tasks that can be executed, monitored, and cancelled within the game framework.
member.remarks: The Task class provides a foundation for implementing long-running operations that need to be executed over multiple game ticks. Unlike standard .NET tasks, these tasks are integrated with the game's tick system and provide cancellation support through cancellation tokens. Tasks can be started, stopped, and monitored through events. The class supports both synchronous and asynchronous stopping mechanisms depending on the allowSynchronousStop parameter.
member.param: Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Whether the task can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for asynchronous tasks that can be executed, monitored, and cancelled within the game framework.
member.remarks: The Task class provides a foundation for implementing long-running operations that need to be executed over multiple game ticks. Unlike standard .NET tasks, these tasks are integrated with the game's tick system and provide cancellation support through cancellation tokens. Tasks can be started, stopped, and monitored through events. The class supports both synchronous and asynchronous stopping mechanisms depending on the allowSynchronousStop parameter.
member.param: Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Whether the task can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.

member.name: P:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.Status
member.summary: Gets the current status of the task.
member.value: The current task status indicating whether it's waiting, running, completed, or cancelled.
member.remarks: Setting the status triggers appropriate events (OnStarted, OnCompleted, OnStopped) and manages the task's lifecycle transitions. The status changes are monitored by the task system.

member.name: E:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.OnStarted
member.summary: Occurs when the task starts running.
member.remarks: This event is raised when the task transitions from WaitingForActivation to Running status. Subscribers can use this event to perform initialization or logging when a task begins execution.

member.name: E:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.OnStopped
member.summary: Occurs when the task stops running, regardless of whether it completed successfully or was cancelled.
member.remarks: This event is raised for both successful completion and cancellation scenarios. It's useful for cleanup operations that need to occur regardless of how the task ended.

member.name: E:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.OnCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the task completes successfully.
member.remarks: This event is raised only when the task finishes its work successfully (not when cancelled). It's raised before the OnStopped event for completed tasks.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.Start
member.summary: Starts the execution of the task.
member.remarks: This method transitions the task from WaitingForActivation to Running status. If a cancellation token was provided, it registers a callback to handle cancellation requests. The method has no effect if the task is not in the WaitingForActivation state.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels the task execution.
member.remarks: This is a convenience method that calls Stop(false) to cancel the task. The actual stopping behavior depends on the allowSynchronousStop parameter set during construction.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the task execution, either due to completion or cancellation.
member.param: True if the task is stopping because it completed successfully; false for cancellation.
member.returns: True if the stop operation was initiated successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The behavior depends on the allowSynchronousStop setting. If synchronous stopping is allowed, the task stops immediately. Otherwise, the stop operation is deferred to the next tick finalizer for completed tasks, or marked as pending cancel for cancelled tasks.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.StopSynchronous(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Immediately stops the task and performs cleanup operations.
member.param: True if the task completed successfully; false if it was cancelled.
member.returns: True if the task was stopped successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs the actual stopping logic including unregistering cancellation tokens, updating the status, and clearing event handlers. It's called either immediately (for synchronous stops) or during tick finalization (for asynchronous stops).

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.TickFinalizer
member.summary: Finalizes the task state during the tick finalizer phase.
member.remarks: This method is called by the game's tick finalizer system to handle deferred task stopping. It checks for pending cancellation or cancellation token requests and performs the appropriate stopping action. For tasks that don't have pending cancellation, it assumes successful completion.

member.name: P:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the task has completed successfully.
member.value: True if the task status is RanToCompletion; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.IsEnded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the task has finished execution (either completed, cancelled, or faulted).
member.value: True if the task is in a terminal state; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is useful for determining if a task is no longer active and can be cleaned up or removed from tracking collections.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.TaskResult`1.#ctor(System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus)
member.summary: Constructor for error result
member.param: Can only pass values that are not TaskStatus.RanToCompletion

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1
member.summary: Represents an abstract awaitable task that can be used with async/await patterns while integrating with the game's thinking and tick systems.
member.typeparam: The type of result produced by this awaitable task.
member.remarks: This class bridges the gap between the game's tick-based execution model and C#'s async/await functionality. It provides a foundation for creating game-specific awaitable operations such as delays, animations, and other time-based tasks that need to execute over multiple game frames. The class implements both the game's IThinker interface for tick-based processing and the .NET INotifyCompletion interface for async/await support.
member.param: Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Whether the task can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Represents an abstract awaitable task that can be used with async/await patterns while integrating with the game's thinking and tick systems.
member.typeparam: The type of result produced by this awaitable task.
member.remarks: This class bridges the gap between the game's tick-based execution model and C#'s async/await functionality. It provides a foundation for creating game-specific awaitable operations such as delays, animations, and other time-based tasks that need to execute over multiple game frames. The class implements both the game's IThinker interface for tick-based processing and the .NET INotifyCompletion interface for async/await support.
member.param: Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Whether the task can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.Start
member.summary: Starts the awaitable task and begins processing if necessary.
member.remarks: This method initiates the task execution and determines whether it needs to continue thinking on subsequent frames. If the task can complete immediately, it will be stopped synchronously or scheduled for finalization depending on the allowSynchronousStop setting.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Gets the awaiter for this awaitable task, enabling async/await syntax.
member.returns: This awaitable instance, which serves as its own awaiter.
member.remarks: This method is required for async/await support and allows the awaitable to be used directly in await expressions without requiring a separate awaiter object.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.GameCore#BaseInterface#IThinker#Think(System.Int32)
member.summary: Processes the thinking logic for this awaitable on each game tick.
member.param: The time delta since the last tick in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This method is called by the game's thinking system on each frame while the task is active. It delegates to the abstract ThinkAction method for specific processing and checks if the task should finish after each update.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the specific thinking action for this awaitable task.
member.param: The time delta since the last tick in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to define what happens during each tick while the awaitable is active. This is where the core logic for progress tracking, countdown timers, or other time-based operations should be implemented.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether this awaitable task should finish execution.
member.returns: True if the task should complete; otherwise, false to continue thinking.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to define the completion condition for the awaitable. It's called after each ThinkAction to determine if the task has reached its completion criteria.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result value of this awaitable task.
member.returns: The result produced by this awaitable task.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to provide the final result of the awaitable operation. It's called when the async/await operation completes.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.Result
member.summary: Gets the result of the task, either the actual result if completed or the current status.
member.value: A TaskResult containing either the result value or the current task status.
member.remarks: This property provides a way to access the result without blocking. If the task is completed, it returns the actual result; otherwise, it returns the current task status.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.System#Runtime#CompilerServices#INotifyCompletion#OnCompleted(System.Action)
member.summary: Schedules a continuation action to be executed when the awaitable completes.
member.param: The action to execute upon completion.
member.remarks: This method is part of the INotifyCompletion interface and is used by the async/await infrastructure to schedule code that should run after the awaitable completes.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the awaitable task and disables thinking.
member.param: True if the task is stopping because it completed successfully; false for cancellation.
member.returns: True if the stop operation was initiated successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method extends the base Task stop behavior by also disabling the thinking process to prevent unnecessary tick processing after the task has been stopped.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.StopSynchronous(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Immediately stops the awaitable task, disables thinking, and executes any pending continuation.
member.param: True if the task completed successfully; false if it was cancelled.
member.returns: True if the task was stopped successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs the actual stopping logic including disabling thinking, executing the continuation callback if the task completed successfully, and cleaning up resources.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.Delay
member.summary: Represents an awaitable delay that can be used to pause execution for a specified duration in game time or real time.
member.remarks: This class provides a way to create delays in game logic that can be adjusted based on frame timing. The delay can be paused, resumed, and configured to account for frame delta time variations. It integrates seamlessly with async/await patterns while working with the game's tick system.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Delay.AdjustByFrameDelta
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the delay should be adjusted based on the frame delta time.
member.value: True to adjust by frame delta time; false to use fixed frame duration.
member.remarks:
When set to false, the delay counts each game tick as a fixed duration based on .
When set to true, the delay is adjusted by the delta time of each frame, making it more accurate to real time.
However, setting this to true may cause jittery behavior if the frame rate is inconsistent.

example.code: var delay = new Delay(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)) { AdjustByFrameDelta = true };

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.#ctor(System.TimeSpan,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Delay class with a TimeSpan duration.
member.param: The duration to delay execution.
Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Optional time adjustment in milliseconds to add to the delay duration.
Whether the delay can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.
member.remarks: This constructor converts the TimeSpan to milliseconds and delegates to the milliseconds constructor. The delay starts immediately upon construction.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Delay class with a duration in milliseconds.
member.param: The duration to delay execution in milliseconds.
Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Optional time adjustment in milliseconds to add to the delay duration.
Whether the delay can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.
member.remarks: The delay starts immediately upon construction. The adjustment parameter can be used to fine-tune the delay duration, which is useful for synchronization or timing corrections.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.Pause(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pauses or resumes the delay execution.
member.param: True to pause the delay; false to resume it.
member.remarks: When paused, the delay will stop counting down and remain at its current remaining time. This method has no effect if the delay has already completed. Pausing a delay effectively stops its thinking process until resumed.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.SetRemainingTime(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the remaining time for the delay to a new value.
member.param: The new remaining time for the delay.
member.returns: True if the remaining time was successfully set; false if the delay has already completed.
member.remarks: This method allows you to modify the remaining time of an active delay, which can be useful for extending or shortening delays based on game events or conditions. The method has no effect if the delay has already completed.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the delay countdown logic on each game tick.
member.param: The time delta since the last tick in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This method is called automatically by the thinking system. It decrements the remaining time either by the actual frame delta (if AdjustByFrameDelta is true) or by the fixed frame duration.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the delay should finish execution.
member.returns: True if the delay time has elapsed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method is called after each ThinkAction to determine if the delay has reached its completion condition (remaining time <= 0).

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Delay.RemainingTime
member.summary: Gets the remaining time before the delay completes.
member.value: A TimeSpan representing the remaining delay duration.
member.remarks: This property provides real-time access to how much time is left in the delay. Once the delay completes, this value will be zero or negative.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Delay.Priority
member.summary: Gets the priority value used for scheduling this delay in the thinking system.
member.value: A priority value based on the remaining time modulo the frame duration, or null if not applicable.
member.remarks: This property is used internally by the game's scheduling system to optimize the order of delay processing. Lower values indicate higher priority.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result value of the delay when it completes.
member.returns: The remaining time in milliseconds when the delay finished (typically zero or negative).
member.remarks: This method is called by the await mechanism when the delay completes. The returned value represents how much time was remaining when the delay finished, which can be useful for timing calculations or detecting early completion.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill
member.summary: Represents an awaitable operation that waits until a specified condition becomes true.
member.remarks: This class provides a way to pause execution until a custom condition is satisfied. The condition is checked every game tick until it returns true. This is useful for waiting on game state changes, entity conditions, or other dynamic criteria.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill.#ctor(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified condition.
member.param: A function that returns true when the wait condition is satisfied.
An optional cancellation token to cancel the wait operation.
Whether the operation can complete synchronously if the condition is already true.
member.remarks: The condition function will be called every game tick until it returns true or the operation is cancelled.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the conditional wait operation.
member.returns: Always returns true when the condition is satisfied.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs no action during each tick - the condition checking is handled in .
member.param: The time delta for this tick (unused).

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the conditional wait should finish by evaluating the condition.
member.returns: The result of the condition function.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout
member.summary: Represents an awaitable operation that waits until a specified condition becomes true or a timeout expires.
member.remarks:
This class combines conditional waiting with timeout functionality. It will complete when either: - The specified condition returns true, or - The timeout period expires
The remaining time when the operation completes indicates whether the condition was met (positive value) or the timeout expired (zero or negative value). This is useful for operations that need to wait for game state changes but have a maximum wait time to prevent infinite blocking.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.AdjustByFrameDelta
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the delay should be adjusted based on the frame delta time.

remarks.list:
- When set to false, the delay counts each game tick as a fixed duration based on .
- When set to true, the delay is adjusted by the delta time of each frame, making it more accurate to real time. However, this may cause jittery behavior if the frame rate is inconsistent.

example.code: var delay = new Delay(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)) { AdjustByFrameDelta = true };

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.#ctor(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified condition and timeout.
member.param: A function that returns true when the wait condition is satisfied.
The maximum time to wait before timing out.
An optional cancellation token to cancel the wait operation.
An optional adjustment value, in milliseconds, to modify the timeout duration.
Whether the operation can complete synchronously if the condition is already true.
member.remarks: The operation will complete when either the condition becomes true or the timeout expires. Use to determine which case occurred by checking if the remaining time is positive.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the conditional wait with timeout should finish.
member.returns: true if the timeout has expired or the condition is satisfied; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the remaining time during each tick of the wait operation.
member.param: The time delta for this tick.
member.remarks: The time reduction depends on the setting.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the remaining time when the operation completes.
member.returns: The remaining time in milliseconds. A positive value indicates the condition was satisfied before timeout; zero or negative indicates the timeout expired.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for awaitable event waiters that can wait for specific events to occur.
member.remarks: This class provides a foundation for creating awaitable operations that complete when specific events are triggered. It integrates with the async/await pattern while working with the game's task system. Derived classes should implement the specific event subscription and un-subscription logic.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EventWaiter class and starts waiting for the event.
member.remarks: The event waiter starts immediately upon construction and will remain active until the target event occurs or the operation is cancelled.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.System#Runtime#CompilerServices#INotifyCompletion#OnCompleted(System.Action)
member.summary: Schedules a continuation action to be executed when the event occurs.
member.param: The action to execute when the event is triggered.
member.remarks: This method is part of the INotifyCompletion interface and is used by the async/await infrastructure to schedule code that should run after the event waiter completes.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Gets the awaiter for this event waiter, enabling async/await syntax.
member.returns: This event waiter instance, which serves as its own awaiter.
member.remarks: This method is required for async/await support and allows the event waiter to be used directly in await expressions.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the event wait operation.
member.remarks: This method is called when the await operation completes. Since event waiters typically don't return specific values, this method performs no action.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.StopSynchronous(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Immediately stops the event waiter and executes any pending continuation.
member.param: True if the event waiter completed successfully; false if it was cancelled.
member.returns: True if the event waiter was stopped successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs the actual stopping logic including executing the continuation callback if the operation completed successfully and cleaning up resources.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.ClearUpEvent
member.summary: Clears up event subscriptions and releases event-related resources.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to define how event subscriptions are cleaned up when the waiter is stopped or cancelled. This prevents memory leaks and ensures proper resource management.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the event waiter and cleans up event subscriptions.
member.param: True if the event waiter is stopping because it completed successfully; false for cancellation.
member.returns: True if the stop operation was initiated successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method extends the base Task stop behavior by also cleaning up event subscriptions before proceeding with the normal stop process.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter`1
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for event waiters that are associated with a specific target object.
member.typeparam: The type of target object that this event waiter is associated with.
member.remarks: This generic version of EventWaiter provides a convenient way to create event waiters that are tied to specific objects, such as entities, components, or other game objects. The target object is automatically cleared when the event waiter is cleaned up to prevent memory leaks.
member.param: The target object that this event waiter is associated with.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter`1.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for event waiters that are associated with a specific target object.
member.typeparam: The type of target object that this event waiter is associated with.
member.remarks: This generic version of EventWaiter provides a convenient way to create event waiters that are tied to specific objects, such as entities, components, or other game objects. The target object is automatically cleared when the event waiter is cleaned up to prevent memory leaks.
member.param: The target object that this event waiter is associated with.

member.name: F:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter`1.Target
member.summary: Gets the target object that this event waiter is associated with.
member.value: The target object, or null if the event waiter has been cleaned up.
member.remarks: This property provides access to the target object for derived classes to use in their event subscription logic. The target is automatically set to null during cleanup.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter`1.ClearUpEvent
member.summary: Clears the target reference to prevent memory leaks.
member.remarks: This implementation of ClearUpEvent sets the Target to null, which helps prevent memory leaks by breaking the reference to the target object. Derived classes can override this method to provide additional cleanup logic while still calling the base implementation.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.NeverEndingTask
member.summary: Represents a task that never completes, designed for scenarios where indefinite waiting is required.
member.remarks: This class provides a way to create awaitable operations that intentionally never complete. It's useful for scenarios where you need to block execution indefinitely, such as waiting for external events that may never occur, or creating placeholder tasks in testing scenarios. Since this task never completes, awaiting it will block the calling code indefinitely unless cancelled through other means.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NeverEndingTask.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Gets the awaiter for this never-ending task, enabling async/await syntax.
member.returns: This task instance, which serves as its own awaiter.
member.remarks: This method is required for async/await support. Since the task never completes, any code awaiting this task will block indefinitely unless interrupted by external means.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NeverEndingTask.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the never-ending task.
member.remarks: Since this task never completes, this method should never be called under normal circumstances. If called, it performs no action as there is no meaningful result to return from a task that never finishes.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NeverEndingTask.System#Runtime#CompilerServices#INotifyCompletion#OnCompleted(System.Action)
member.summary: Schedules a continuation action to be executed when the task completes.
member.param: The action to execute upon completion.
member.remarks: Since this task never completes, the continuation will never be executed. This method is part of the INotifyCompletion interface but performs no action for a never-ending task.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.NextTick
member.summary: Represents an awaitable operation that completes after the next game tick occurs.
member.remarks: This class is useful when you need to delay execution by exactly one frame or game tick. It's commonly used to ensure operations happen after all current frame processing is complete, or to break up long-running operations across multiple frames.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NextTick.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An optional cancellation token to cancel the wait operation.
member.remarks: The operation will complete after the next game tick unless cancelled via the token.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NextTick.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the next tick operation.
member.returns: Always returns true when the next tick completes.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NextTick.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Marks that a tick has occurred during the think operation.
member.param: The time delta for this tick (unused in this implementation).

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NextTick.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the next tick operation should finish.
member.returns: true if a tick has occurred; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataApi
member.summary: 云数据统一访问入口，提供查询和事务操作的一致API

remarks.para: 该类作为云数据系统的主要入口点，解决了查询和修改操作分离的不一致问题。
所有云数据操作都可以从此类开始，提供统一的用户体验。
底层委托给 和 实现。

list.item: Player.Id: 当局游戏的槽位编号(0,1,2...)，仅在当前游戏会话有意义
User.UserId: 平台用户的全局唯一标识，云数据应使用此ID确保持久性

remarks.para: 货币数据具有特殊的原子性保证，支持AddCurrency和CostCurrency等事务操作。
货币值不能为负数，CostCurrency操作会验证余额充足性。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.QueryCappedDataBatchAsync(System.Int64[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180})
member.summary: 异步批量查询指定用户的有上限数据
member.param: 要查询的用户ID数组，不能为null或空
要检索的数据键集合，每个键不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为null或空
member.returns: 包含查询结果的任务。成功时返回 集合， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 有上限数据支持动态调整上限值，常用于体力、经验等有最大值限制的数值。
可以通过 操作修改数值和上限。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.CheckNameClaimedStatusAsync(EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180,EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180)
member.summary: 异步检查指定名称在给定命名空间中是否已被占用
member.param: 命名空间键，不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为空
要检查的名称，不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为空
member.returns: 包含名称占用状态的任务。成功时返回 ， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 名称系统提供全局唯一性保证，常用于玩家昵称、公会名称等需要唯一标识的场景。
名称一旦被占用，可以通过 DeleteName 操作进行删除，或通过新的 ClaimNewName 操作占用其他名称。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.SearchClaimedNamesAsync(EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180,EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180)
member.summary: 异步搜索包含指定部分名称的已占用名称
member.param: 命名空间键，不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为空
要搜索的部分名称，支持模糊匹配，不能为空
member.returns: 包含匹配名称记录的任务。成功时返回 集合， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。最多返回15个结果。

remarks.para: 该方法执行大小写不敏感的部分匹配搜索，适用于名称联想和重复检查。
为了防止性能问题，单次搜索最多返回15个匹配结果。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.QueryUserListItemsAsync(System.Int64,EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

列表键，不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为空
最大返回数量，如果指定则返回最新的指定数量的项目，null表示返回所有项目
member.returns: 包含列表项记录的任务。成功时返回 集合， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

如果指定了maxCount，将返回最新的指定数量的项目。
列表项支持添加、修改和删除操作，可以存储任意二进制数据。

member.returns: 包含查找结果的任务。成功时返回 ， 指示是否找到项目以及项目数据，失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 该方法通过全局唯一ID进行精确查找，不需要指定用户ID或列表键。
返回的 提供类型安全的空值检查。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.ExecuteTransactionAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{EngineInterface.BaseType.TransactionOperation},EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar255)
member.summary: 异步执行云数据事务，如果任何操作失败，整个事务将被回滚
member.param: 要执行的事务操作集合，不能为null或空
事务描述，将存储到数据库中用于审计，不超过255个UTF-8字符
member.returns: 包含事务执行结果的任务。成功时返回 ， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 事务提供ACID特性保证，所有操作要么全部成功，要么全部失败。
支持的操作类型包括：数据设置/删除、货币加减、列表项管理、名称占用等。
事务描述将记录在审计日志中，建议提供有意义的描述信息。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.TransactionBuilder.ModifyCappedData(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,EngineInterface.BaseType.UserDataResetOption)
member.summary: 修改有上限的数据，若修改后的值超过上限，则整个事务失败。 若从未设置过指定Key的数据，则设置上限为newCap，并设置当前值为delta。
member.param: 数据键，不超过180个UTF-8字符
变化量，可以为正数（增加）或负数（减少）
新的上限值，必须大于等于0

重置选项，控制数据何时自动重置为0。可选值：
: 每N小时重置
: 每N天重置
: 每N周的指定星期重置
: 每N月重置
: 每N年重置
: 永不重置（默认）
member.returns: 当前构建器实例，支持链式调用

remarks.para: 此方法用于管理具有上限限制的数据，如体力、经验池等。
计算逻辑：新值 = 当前值 + delta，如果新值 > newCap，则事务失败。
重置选项可以实现定期重置功能，例如每日体力恢复、每周活跃度重置等。
如果数据不存在，则从0开始计算。

member.exception: 当key为空或超过长度限制时
当newCap小于0时

member.summary: 重置有上限数据，将当前值重置为0
